content:
Posted: February 19
												Before I start I would like to put it out there that I really enjoyed the the original "The Hunter" despite its pay to win set-up.Pros:-I think this game has a lot of potential for being good. -There is actually a sense of progression as you explore the map to find things and gain points to unlock perks, build hunting blinds, and buy weapons. -The maps seem very large although there are only 2 maps as far as I can tell. -The interface and UI are much better compared to its predecesser.-There are more factors to the hunt, such as , wind direction and sound levels-The graphics and sounds are better in this game but I have yet to hear a bleat from a doe I hear a bunch of grunts but no bleats, maybe that is something they will change in the future?Cons:-The game is sadly buggy right now, my first experience with an animal in this game is three doe coming out in front of me and one of them just trotting in circles. Every one of my shots but two led to a deer being stuck on something or running in circles as well.-A small annoyance to me is the fact that I can place a waypoint on the main map but it has not shown up for me on the compass or the huntermate-The crashed on me a few times-There are sadly less weapons than the original Hunter, it does not have crowsbows or anything, but I hope to see them added soon.In conclusion I think this game is definitely going to be good at some point but when is the question when. It has its problems but I think it will be the top hunter game if they put time into it.

Posted: February 16
												This review is written on 4.5 hours of playtime:To start, I love this game. Everyone's biggest issue with theHunter classic was that you had to pay (real money) for weapons and items. In CotW, you earn money to buy them by completing missions and harvesting animals. I love using the camera to take photos of an absolutely stunning visual experience.However, there are a lot of bugs, almost too many to mention and probably some that have not even been noticed yet. This is not acceptable for a full release game, if there is such a term anymore. It's 2017, developers dish out patches left and right to make thier games better, and I have a hard time believing Expansive Worlds will just up and give up on this game that they have been so passionate about.Verdict: If you want a hunting game, and hate microtransactions, this is the game for you. Otherwise, stick to the 'free' theHunter : Classic version for now. P.S. EW has voiced that both versions of theHunter will be living on, and that they are to go hand-in-hand.-Review will be tweaked as play time and patches go on-

												This is a working progress review. My first time playing a hunter game as my old potato laptop couldnt run the old hunter game. I have to say this game is really good so far. Ive only really hunted deer and foxes so far mind you.Pros: 1). The Graphics are amazing in this game from the scenary to the wildlife.2). The reserves are brilliantly done and are huge in scale.3). Sounds are brilliant also, from the natural ambience to the gun sounds. Everything that makes a noise in this game sounds like it should.4). The wildlife that are in the game look amazing (although thier eyes look wierd up close).5). Really nice weapon models.6). Single player and multiplayer/co-op.Cons:1). AI sometimes bugs out and gets stuck on things. And some of the animations aren't very fluid ect, when the bear stands up, it sort of telleports upright.2). After you fire your weapon sometimes your rifles scope bugs out. (not sure how to explain it).3). There's a few animals in the game you can kill but get nothing for, like rabbits and squirils.4). No trophy system (Yet).5). No leaderboards.6). Needs real bows not just crappy compound ones. And more rifles of different calibers.7). Should be more customization options for you character to make your clothing unique.8). Tons of bugs ranging from your guns going invisible and not being able to look down you scope without it being at a angle so you can see anything through it, to your game crashing alot (mines only started crashing after 15 hours playtime mind you).9). content:
Posted: March 9
												I would like to start of by mentioning that this game looks beautiful, the sounds and feeling from the elements while going around tracking down game is something I have not seen in another game atleast not at this caliber. I'd love to give a really positive review, but sadly there are too many gamebreakers at the moment to try getting strangers of me to buy this game, unless you don't mind overlooking them.The first bug I encountered was the animals getting stuck between bushes and rocks, this one I noticed on my third kill of the game as a poor deer was running and running between a rock and a tree. After my current hours in the game I have seen this tens of times allready, but I wouldent call it gamebreaking, but it's a minus.In real hunting you rarly go for multiple shots towards diffrent games, but if you do in this game it seems like the tracking gets thrown of abit. Vital/flesh wounds on 'non' rare game not showing up & neither are tracks. A couple of times all tracks just disappeared all together and the only way I found to fix it was to reset the game, wich is a blunder when you are far of a outpost hunting(as in you only spawn in around the nearest outpost).The mission system is a good adition, but some of the missions are abit random to complete and some are better of leaving undone til you can afford and/or able to buy better equipment(ex. pictures of several animals of same race in a set zone). Some quests seems bugged, as they would not complete even if conditions are met(ex. killing deer at night).What I do like is how much of a grind it is to max your hunting skills and perks you can pick up.The real gamebreaker for me is the random and unexpected crashes, screen freezes with looping sound. Giving it a quick search just shows how many are affected by this and there has not been a single respons from the game developers about this yet. They seem to happen more and more depending on how much of a map you have explored, as I can play one of the zones without a crash for longer then the more explored zone(but what do I know). So for me when I am in the zone, focused to bring down game, take a shot and trying to track down the giant moose to see how big it actually was. And for it all to be a waste of time by a frozen screen and looping sound, meh I got better things to do then playing a non-finished game.My review of this game were from the last week intil today, 10/3-17. I might change my mind about this if there is a game fixing patch coming, but I would advice to wait to pick this up to see if they manage to change this visual pearl to a hour sandbox.

Posted: February 16
												Pros:-Looks good-Sounds good-Feels goodCons:-Buggy-Unpolished-Very arcadey features that can't be ignored or turned off such as perks, skills, XP, some infuriating woman talking to you, weapon 'stats', icons everywhere, information like a health bar, and a sound meter on the screen not even on the hunter mate, compass is again on the screen when it should be on the huntermateWait until it's fixed, in its current state it is basically beta.I'm unhappy about the arcadey stuff. I knew they were going to make it more 'accesible' which is never a good thing with games, but hoped all the rubbish like XP and perks would be optional, so far some of the visual clues can be turned off, as well as the annoying missions and tutorial, but you can't get around the XP and perks.I would love the devs to have two modes. One game like mode like it is now, and another simulation mode like the Classic Hunter.Honestly if this is the beginning of the end for this game then it will be a shame because the engine seems great and the environments look stunning, it has just been rushed and they're trying to casualise it to get new players. I know I have a low amount of hours in the game for now but I've played enough of the hunter 'classic' to judge it so far.Wait until the game is fixed and polished, hopefully the developers will sort the bugs out and listen to the community.Update 19/3/17: I'm glad the devs are working on the bugs and releasing patches but the game still feels very unfinished, I would wait still.

content:
Posted: February 23
												This really deserves a much higher rating from buyers. If you're even remotely interested in the title buy it. Honestly wouldn't put it past special interest groups to buy the game just to run the rating down. Anyhow I can't figure out what most of the bad review are talking about.Breaking down into pros and cons....Pros- ran 60 to 90 fps without any drops on 1080 custom all ultra- in several hours I unlocked 1/5 of the map and explored maybe 1/20. It would take weeks to explore just one of the two maps completely. It is absolutely huge!- Absolutely gorgeous open world environment. One of the best I've seen in any genre.- Better animal AI than i've seen in any game.- Great rpg skill building. No just running out and shooting rockets on the first day. (ok rockets is hyperbole)-quite realistic tracking after wounding. I made a bad shot on one animal and tracked it for over an hour in the dark. Unfortunately the AI did just what real deer do. It circled back on its own tracks several times till I couldn't tell which way it went in the dark anymore.-don't worry it's easy enough to make a good kill shot with even the .243 you start with. I read one report that made it sound like it happened every time. Not sure what they expect for a starter rifle? 475 h&h maybe? That was only one of many I shot that turned out that way.-No da*n bango music. For anyone that remembers the hunting games where you had the volume turned way up to hear animals and bam, suddenly you forget when you pause it blares frackn banjo music.-I started on the European map. Pleasant voice acting. Very well done.-And the list goes on, but I'll stick to the basicsCons - One time.... One time a deer got stuck....- The store interface just felt a little clunky. Not really bad or game breaking. Very minor update would do it. Really it might just be a matter of preference like ford dash controls vs. volvo.This is one of a very few games i'd say absolutely buy it. It's worth the $30. But hey if you're the next warren buffett or something by all means wait for a sale. (ok i seriously doubt he's a gamer... just sayin)

												First off i love hunting and do it alot. But this isnt hunting. this is a walker simulator with a gun in your hands, thats just it. DONT BUY IT!

												If wandering through a wood seeing no wildlife is your thing....wander through a wood seeing no wildlife, at least you'll get fresh air and exercise. This game makes little attempt to gently induct beginners; it has a poorly designed "tutorial", which says things like "you should see some tracks". You don't. Then you wander aimlessly, with the game randomly selecting a gun,or  a lure or binoculors without explanation, until you stumble on where the map is and a blue pointer then magically appears guiding you to a target. But it leads to nothing. Not even with binocuours 2 metres away.The binocular vison is blurred and it's almost impossible to pan, as you inexplicably have to hold down right click as you look for...nothing. I never really got started with this but then there was nothing to get started on even after an hour - that's an hour of my life I won't get back but thankfully Steam's refund policy means at least I'll get the not inconsiderable price of the game back.

Posted: February 17
												This game has potential, but typical of an Expensive Worlds release, it's chock full of bugs. The hit detection is just awful.  Shots that would be kill shots in real life are flesh wounds in this game.  What is really frustrating is the misleading "free gun and gillie suit" promotion.  If you have both theHunter classic and theHunter: Call of the Wild, you don't get the gun and gillie suit for free, you get the opportunity to buy them.  Yes, you buy them with in-game money, but it takes a long time to earn enough to buy them.  As of right now, I can't recommend this game, and I wish I wouldn't have bought it.  Maybe after a few patches, and some more patches to kill the bugs they introduce with those patches, it will be playable, but right now, I'd stay away.

content:
Posted: February 16
												theHunter: Call of the Wild,I'd give her 5 stars. Not entirely sure what all the hate and absolute disgust is all about, I have found nothing but greatness in the product.Yes, sure there are a few issues here and there, but nothing that patches won't be able to iron out. Right, just a brief reason why I rate COTW so highly with a pro's and con's list below.Call of the Wild has some of the most beautiful, calming and pleasuring forests, plains, rivers and mountains to explore, the ambiance the game creates in that regard is utter beauty.The animals themselves are really great to look at and stalk. Sure the Buck do not have the hugest varity of Antlers out there, but i am curious to see what the future holds in that regard. Thus far each hunt has been majestic in its own way. Each hunt has brought about its own challenges and adventure with it. From hunting Red Fox to Various types of Deers, some animals are in a herd which force me to choose wisely and play my tactics carefully if i wish to leave with the best scoring animal, those that travel alone are often very sneaky and sometimes downright genius, though with enough patience and technique, the hunt will reward you with the sight of beauty and the pleasure of the one shot kill. (To which I have noticed a lot of people complaining about 3 shots to bring down a buck.... I have yet to have such an issue. 12 shots fired. 12 hits, 12 kills.Anyhow onto the Pro's and Con's list.Con's:1) Small game and Big game create the same noise while passing through foilage/bushes which is hugely missleading or should i say somewhat confusing, I have caught myself doing 360s with the rifle aimed, looking for that deer that made that racket while passing through the bushes, to see only later that it was merely a rabbit. Very odd for a Rabbit to make such a loud crash through the bushes.2) A couple of glitches while in Map mode, You have to constantly zoom in and out to see the borders of various places on the map, which isnt very helpful while trying to complete missions, but by no means a game breaker.3) A few animals are still getting glitched/stuck on various rocks and or tree trunks, Thus far has only happend twice out of the 12 animals i have had the opportunity of taking down.That is really it thus far.Pros:1) The beautifully designed Forests, Plains, Rivers, Mountains etc etc are a sight for sore eyes. I have no issues getting lost in them and just strolling through watching gazing Buck stroll through the wild. 2) The ambiance in the wild is fantastic, it really makes you feel as if you are in the wild, from the birds chirping, to the foxes howling (Squeeking?) to the birds flying out of the bushes while you hastly run past. The wind that blows over the plains and the odd time Thunder strikes the silent evening sky behind you. Its brilliantly done.3) The Animals are very goodlooking, From the Rabbit through to the various Deers (I have yet to find myself a Bear or any other larger Game, thus i have to hold that comment). They act very well, and I have yet to have issues with them spooking just to stop a few meters later. When they spook, my god do they run, and stop very very far away. Have had some fantastic 2 hour marches following those Tracks.4) The whole feeling to the game is great, It is not elite hardcore, but is by no means like a Call of Duty Hunter. I see tons of complaints that the game is far too arcade like, but I cannot seem to grasp what that means. The hunts are by no means easy, You can spend a very long time tracking down your prey, very easily spook him off and very easily miss your shot. (Unless ofcourse you are using your rifle like its a machine gun and shooting every animal in sight... well then you have no idea what hunting is about).Thats about it for now, I will ofcourse update the review at a later stage.All in all,I will be spending tons of hours on this beaut of a game.

content:
Posted: February 20
theHunter: Call of The Wild has the potential to be the best hunting game out there. It's a great foundation for the perfect hunting game. Unfortunately, that's all the game is at its current state. It's pretty much just a pretty landscape with everything else feeling rushed. When it actually works and you don't encounter one of the many bugs it's a really enjoyable and relaxing experience, but way too often do you find your immersion getting completely ruined by a visual bug or weird AI.Not only that, I feel like it lacks some critical content that you kind of expect from any hunting game. Here are two of the major things I think the game is lacking at the moment, to at least make it a complete hunting game and putting the glitches aside:1. Birds. You can hear them all around you. There are some oddly placed seagulls (or whatever they are) here and there that flies away by the noise you make. But there are no birds to hunt. I was really expecting this to be in the game at release, but knowing where the developers are coming from (the microtransaction hell that is theHunter: Classic) I'm guessing it will be a future DLC. Hard to say if the developers ran out of time or if this is an intentional decision. The shotguns are there to tease you though.2. Any means of transportation. The map is HUGE. It needs some kind of vehicles. And at the pace the character is running it feels even bigger. Sure, you can fast travel between the outposts but first you'll have to find them, usually by going to a lookout point to reveal them on the map and then walk to them to claim them and just hope that you don't accidentally stumble between two static rocks that somehow magically squishes you to death on your way there. Yes, that happened not only once, but three times. I remember playing Deer Hunter 3 back in the days and thought it was cool that you could get around with ATV's, snowmobiles and such. Guess this might be DLC too, concidering there are achievements for traveling "BY FOOT". Feels weird to state that unless they have some other way of travelling planned.Now those are just the features I feel that the game is currently lacking. As an addition to that it's riddled with bugs and some of the most horrible AI/pathfinding I've seen in a game. Which is a good way to completely ruin your immersion that you otherwise get from the stunning visuals. Squirrels gets stuck humping rocks, rabbits run in circles at the speed of light, deer gets stuck against trees and rocks and I've even seen a group of four different animal types running into eachother in a mess that looked like the queue line to the Noah's ark. I try my best to just ignore these derpy animals and move on but you see them way too often to just simply ignore them. I know it must be hard to code AI and especially animal like behaviour but I still don't expect to see these kind of situations in a full release of a hunting game. I've seen a whole pack of wild boars just running into an invisible wall forever. There doesn't seem to be any fall damage in the game, yet somehow you sometimes die if you get stuck between two rocks or try to climb them as I mentioned earlier. I even just flat out died walking on a flat surface at one point. The screen has gone completely blurry as if the field of depth was bugged and also completely red after I died once. These were fixed by just clicking ESC twice to bring up the menu interface (which can be a little bit disorienting at times when it comes to equipment and such) and then close it again. The smartphone is visible in some of the cutscenes, just floating there (sometimes upside down). I've found a hunting stand that was not buildable for whatever reason (surely the developers must have had time to test this once they put it down on the map?) and seen some weirdly placed street signs and poles. There was also this one pile of stones which gives you lore that had the trigger 8 meters underground so it was impossible to activate. I've seen some floating 3D sprites and trees that goes through rocks and some terrain deformities (with stretched textures), but usually you have to look really close for these types of minor glitches. The one visual glitch that occurs the most is the one with parts of the scope disappearing after you take a shot.With all this being said, I really hope the developers listens to the community and addresses these issues. I'm really looking forward to future patches and updates, it can only get better from here and hopefully we'll have our hands on the best hunting experience one can have on a PC. I tried to summarize my experience with the game so far in this review, for the developers and others thinking about buying it, just to let you know what you can expect from it at its current state. I have no complaints about the sounds nor the visuals, but as for now I'll give this game a rating of "Not recommended" until it gets some fixes.

content:
Posted: February 19
												Week 3-4 update:  Looking like devs are making progress but the title still isnt fully polished.The game does run on some older machines but dont expect the world.  If you have crashes, its possible others are experiencing the same.  Devs had made it clear that if you document your bugs clearly & accurately, they will respond in return.   That may not mean your bug is fixed today, but you wont be ignored.I cant yet give this title a thumbs up, because there are still a number of bugs to be worked out.  Im hopeful, but not in a hurried kind of way.  In a couple of months, when its ready, the environments in this game will blow you away.------------------Weekend 1 review -- not reccomended.  Codebase appears incomplete and untested.  This is effectively a pay-to-play beta release, and it is quite broken.I suspect only the most elite high-end systems were tested in the undoubtedly brief QA cycle, and anyone using even remotely old hardware will be out of luck until many bugs are ironed out.For me, I have 2 systems that ran the orginal "theHunter" flawlessly at max settings, and i had hoped that with the same hareware at modest settings i'd be able to evaluate this new release.   But so far its no deal.  with my i7 2600k + gtx 570 the 3d engine will render 1-2 frames before it crashes. Pretty much crashes immediately after the logo screens.  Same exact result for my mobile i7+675gtx.This game obviously has promise and I'll be happy to give it a good reivew once its actually finished.  But for now, they appear to be funding their development cycle with pay to play beta shenanigans.Buyer Beware.

												This game was released a little early for my liking. It feels like a Beta and there are quite a few bugs. That's the negative. The positive is that the graphics is really great and the gameplay, which may not suit COD fans, is slow and deliberate. This is as close to real life as you can get.Am I glad I bought it? Yes, the bugs will get fixed. DLCs will come out with new reserves and gear. Bear with it. It's still great game with more potential the classic version. It was relatively cheap. Don't curse the Devs, no-one can write perfect code. It was a rush to market, probably for financial reasons. It's just as frustrating as real life when you don't take the time to get a perfect shot. Lots of work ahead, but it's still a great game.

content:
Posted: April 10
												While I would reccomend this game for the hunting enthusiast, I would caution casual or fast-paced gamers from playing. This game requires A LOT of time and effort to get anything done. Movement is slow, the game is quite demanding on moderate systems, and kills are very few and far between. Just today, I have spent almost four full hours of playing the game and have only managed to kill one deer. Yes, the game looks amazing and is very realistic, but it is certianly not something that the "average gamer" would enjoy. Where other games have long hours of grinding, where you're at least doing SOMETHING, this game has you walking (at an extremely slow pace to keep the animals from getting scared off) for hours on end with little-to-no signs of life for most of that time.While I commend the developers for making a challenging and realistic game, I would advise them to put options into the game to increase the spawn rate of animals in single player worlds and on multiplayer servers. To spend so much time in the game and get little out of it is not something that people enjoy. The game isn't difficult, it just discourages people playing it because of how little actually happens in the game.

content:
Posted: February 22
I am deeply confused - what's this game supposed to be?Sandbox game? Hunting "Simulation"? Arcade Hunter? Open World Adventure?First of all: Endless, purposeless tranquilityif you enjoy walking up a beautiful virtual hill for 15 minutes without any further purpose but to reach a viewing platform, then this game is totally for you and you should just ignore my review.Second: Oh my god, dem bugs. Others have mentioned it before, but this game is far from being ready for release. For early access the level of bugs and issues would have been acceptable, but still better to call it an open beta.The main problem I have with this, is that ExpansiveWorlds (Avalanche Studios) has a long-standing track record of releasing unfinished content and often never polishing it to perfection even way later. This is true for basically every update theHunter:classic received, but especially for theHunter:Primal - a game that was sold in some kind of beta-state (especially content-wise) and never made it any further.Third: Blimey, dem graphics!The game looks awesome! The vegetation, the scenery, the lighting, the animal models, the animations (well, besides the players hands, what the frog am I doing? Running in the praying mantis karate base pose?) - all looks terrific and stunning. The way you leave a trail of flattened grass behind is just cool. Ok, it looks like you're a Mafiosi that just dragged a concrete-cuffed rival to his favourite dumpster lake, but hey, it's still a cool effect. A shame that the graphics are the only outstanding part of this game. I am more willing to overlook less-than-perfect graphics than flawed game design or mechanics.Last but by no means least - the real review - what is this game meant to be and why did they get it all backwards?So you got theHunter:classic, a massive open-world hunting game with plenty of content and great game mechanics. It just suffers from a meanwhile rather dated graphic engine  (fair enough being already 8 years old) and a microtransaction-based business model that has met plenty of criticism. Yet the cash-cow seems still lactating, as they are still keeping the game alive.So what to do to lead theHunter into the future. Develop a successor and kill your cash flow of the old game? Much better to produce something slightly different that recruits new customers, fascinates your old clientèle and still doesn't stop them from spending on the old one. Much better idea indeed. If you're able to pull it off, that is.So why not make an open world hunting game like the hunter that still has a story line. Red Dead Redemption hunting themed, basically. Nice idea.But then why they got it all backwards? Why does the actual hunting feel like you're mowing down the imbecile cousins of some majestic animals you dreamt of hunting all your life? The actual hunting is no challenge at all, you just need to be in the right place, and the animals will be easy to harvest.The "story line" (in brackets, as I am not sure yet, there's any red line through the story - it might just be random bits) on the other hand is slow as a sloth. A couple of hours in and I haven't even proceeded much in the tutorial story line (it is supposed to be a tutorial, right?). All I did is wander lengthily through a beautiful landscape getting sidetracked by some dull hunting while trying to get to a lodge or view point or camp.I feel a good hunting game with a story line should be exactly the other way around: extensive, to some extend challenging hunting embedded in a faster paced, enthralling story line. That'd be an interesting cross-over game between an emersion-intense hunting game and a hunting-themed arcade/adventure game. This game is exactly the opposite. It got real dull real quick for me, and I am a sucker for a good hunting game.I'll probably wait for a follow-up of theHunter:classic. Or maybe even a similar product by a competent competitor that might be released in a rather finished state - one should be allowed to dream big.

												Absolutely loving this game! I am not having any of the issues others have reported. content:
Posted: March 5
												Graphics are Great! Overall with little more then 4 hours in, I have not noticed any type of bugs nor issues with game play!     Multiplayer seems to be where the bugs are, most of my time is in singleplayer!    1- it is little bit of a grind since everything is a travel and things in the store are expensive which earning the currency takes some time!    2- This is a simulation game so it is not like shooting in an arcade even though there are moments it seems arcade like!     3-  It is seemingly better then what alot of reviews stated from my point as i am maxed out on everything with my system.   Some things can change and hopefully content will be added in future as more animals, areas so fourth! It is a grind and as you skill up your weapon and stalking/ambusher skills it will become better!    Here is an update at 19 hours logged!     -  As you skill up on your weapons and tracking skills, the game becomes more enjoyable. I have found very few bugs and nothing breaking the game or enough toi turn me away from it!      -  Unlocking outposts increases you vast area of where you can start from much faster and closer to different game!    -   Unlocking "Need Zone" rather bedding, feeding water, rest area greatly shows travel patterns and time frame to best hunt it!    - Callers are an all but must need to have some success!     - takes time to learn point of impact as for me still figuring out the bear claw lite!

content:
Posted: February 26
												I am truly disappointed in this game so far. Looks so amazing yet the amount of bugs tells me they rushed to release. Not to mention the horrible gui. For gods sake get rid of that annoying beep while navigating the menu. Besides the game not being playable for me (buggy, not a system spec problem). While as visually appealing as it is. They have missed the mark. The entire experience is dulled by the Gui, and lack of customization. You start the game with no idea what to do. For me I was unable to see tracks at all until I installed on my other pc and then I was finally able to see the tracks glow. Then that quit working on that pc.  Sigh's after about 5hrs of gameplay I still have not found out how to buy weapons or change camo. Maybe part of this is because of my inability to play properly due to bugs. effects not working invincible animals etc.Or maybe just because the game has no proper gui and seems half done. If the dev's would read this then I would note that personally I love "The Hunter Classic" and have poored a large chunk of money into it.  So please, bring back ALL the things that made the original great...Things like the huntermate beeing used to track. An intuitive menu that allows for quick and easy access to all equiptment and customizations. All the amazing hunting types. Turkey, ducks, etc. With all that said, I think the reason I am so disappointed is because I feel very pationate about this game. I was hoping for at least what I was able to get from the original. Then after the failure of primal. I purchase a third installment and once again feel let down. Now at the game's current state I would not recommend this at all. Maybe a year down the road they may be able to get this working. Although so far they cant even get primal to save the game. So, yah for me you guys have close to $300 from me. I am am not likely to buy anything else unless I see some serious improvements in the direction of your games.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1
												This game is absolutely gorgeous. Everything about this game excited me from the first time I saw it. Coming from the original theHunter, this is a breath of fresh air. No subscriptions. No penalties for wrong caliber. This is really an open-world hunting experience that can be sort of mission based if you choose, or not. Pros: Graphics, Animals, Realism, Map, "Noccys" (Binoculars).Cons:Bugs, Glitchy Animal AI, No "Back to Main Menu" Option.I feel that at this price point, this game is a steal. 30$ may seem steep, but AAA titles like Madden and FIFA release the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game every year, riddled with microransactions and ways for them to make money... ON TOP OF A 60$ PRICE TAG. This game is worth the money, and with a few patches, it can definitely become a great game. Have patience: not only in the game hunting a bear, but with the development team on patching bugs.

												Great Game!I don't think I to date have ever played a game with a more visually appealing and realistic representation of the great outdoors!In-fact I am frequently placed in something of an environmental "uncanny valley" as part of me actually feels like the wind should be hitting my face, and the smell of the forest should be filling my nostrils.It's going through a lot of growing pains which I feel confident the developers will resolve in time, but despite its buggy state will still gladly recommend this game, as it provides a hunting experience and atmosphere like none other in a game!

I'm not a big hunter fan And I love it. There things that could be improved like trophy seeing or bragging rights if you will. But for the money well wourth it..

content:
Posted: February 16
												Mixed....since i dont think anyone wants to read an entire essay on this- i will make it quick.Pros:•Very nice graphics•One time purchase•Variety of maps•Variety of game to hunt•Variety of weapons to hunt with•Some sort of misson "plot" (didnt explore that fully yet)•Multiplayer•Has some nice effects (eg leaving a trail in the grass you walk)•You can basiclly hunt when, where and what you want•Not very un-realistic•...Cons:-Contains many bugs-Animal AI is not too great (at least what ive seen)-Animal sound are lacking of significance-No deployable hunting towers/stands-No default hunting towers/stands (please dont argue with those "sheds" which can be built up.....)-No truRACS system (racks of animals varie too little...theHunter : cassic does not face this problem)-Lack of animal significance (animals of the same species do not vary in enough graphical features)-The UI and settings can be somewhat annoying-Not enogh has been done since the first beta (yes i was part of that)-Animals sometimes survive as if they were invincible-Huge racks are nothing special...(in the hunter : classic, a big rack was very rare hence it was exiting to find one. Here, all deer and so have monster racks making those boring...)So yes, it has its flaws...quite many to be exact. But its only released since a day and we must give it a chance to develop a bit. Its recieving tons of input with bugs and suggestions, lets hope they are head of by the developers. Its quite fun to play and is a game with much potentiol.*adding on this as time goes by....

content:
Posted: February 19
												They got me again.  Just to give you an idea of my backgrond in this game/studio I've been a paying member of TheHunter since 2011, I'm a bit of a fanboy of that game and I've bought about every weapon, clothing, equipment items that's in the store and spend like 80,000 EM$ or so. I was sort of disapointed when I heard the primal and call of the wild were projects just because I sort of feel like they are slow to implent bug fixes and requested changes but quick to release reskins to bring in more cash and these projects I'm sure will pull resources away from thehunter.When Primal was released perhaps a bit early it was full of bugs and I never felt like it really took off. I think maybe like me a bunch of people purchased it early to get the free shotgun in TheHunter and then tried playing it once or twice and relized it was too much of a headache to play. I can't imagine I have much more than a few hours played most of which I was tabbed to youtube trying to figure out what the point was or how to work around bugs. This game feels alot like the Primal release I mean my first 30 seconds in game I found a menu location that you can't exit and locked my in an endless loop I have to task manager kill the program to get out of. I have since found a work around but 30 seconds in to a released game I shouldn't be hitting stupid bugs like that. Next I releize the game is trying to fake out full screen by displaying widescreen and cutting off the edges mean I have no visability to the gps without pulling up a map, my ammo is half cut off along with my waypoints and direction heading. Haven't found a fix to this yet. Running around the game feels clunky as hell when it rains or you get to the top of a hill,  not  big concerns because I have all the settings to ultra and I'm not sure I have the queipment to run at the res but the FPS drop in certain situations is insanse. Many of the animals I've shot were stuck in rocks which is pretty lame. The game doesn't really flow but granted I'm only an hour in. When I can get my tracker on the screen it's completly transparent and useless. In some areas the animals seem to call nonstop for some reason. Animals seem to appear out of no where and don't seem to be easily spooked. So far I've only seen male animals so I'm not sure if you'll see heards of females like in TheHunter. Overall I'm thinking you should pass on this game for the time being. Its to much of a headache to play and who want's to play a game like that. It's pretty much primal all over again. Granted I will say if this was a prerelease game I might have recommended it as one to watch when it's launched but to say this is a store ready release is bull. I really hope this doesn't become like Primal where everyone is so turned off by the horrible launch they never try it again and it dies.

content:
Posted: February 17
												Beautiful and immersive environment. Don't have to pay for everything in-game. I've only played a few hours but I've really enjoyed it. At times I feel like it's too easy to get an animal, at other times I feel like it's too hard, and sometimes I feel like it's just right, which, as someone who hunts, is actually pretty realistic. I've only encountered one bug which was my items stopped working but I just had to go into the menu and switch items from there once and then everything worked fine again. Reading some of the negative reviews, there are aspects that seem reasonable to criticize so I hope the devs will continue working on and improving this game. Even as is though, at least as I've experienced it, I think it's a fun game that I feel comfortable recommending. A big issue for me, is that this game needs to improve on it's small game selection. I really hope they make the squirrels and rabbits huntable. As of now you can shoot them, they'll die, but then you can't harvest them. Bird hunting(pheasant, quail, dove, etc.) would be a great addition as well, especially if it gave using hunting dogs, pointers or retrievers, as an option. And this seems less likely, but it would be really neat if they also added the ability to hunt things like squirrels, rabbits, bears, etc. with hounds, though I'm not sure how well some of those would translate to the game. I imagine if they do add any of this it will be DLC rather than free, which is kind of disappointing, but I'm sure I'll end up buying it if it's reasonably priced.In short: Recommended. I've enjoyed the gameplay and evnironment and haven't really had crash or bug issues. Some of the negative reviews make some good points though and I hope the devs continue to improve the game. Needs more small game options.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15
												This has got to be one of the best, most annoying games I've played in recent years. The hunting experience is fantastic and the gameplay is a joy, however the constant 'quality of life' issues just make it a hassle to play.The maps are huge and detailed however movement speed is glacial and there are no vehicles. Fast travel is limited to a handful of spaced out locations that must be unlocked by spending hours walking to them.Huge amounts of grinding are required to unlocked better equipment, for some bizarre reason the developer has felt the need to restrict players as to their style of play, perhaps to add longevity, but I would have appreciated the option to just unlock everything, after all, I am the player and it is my game.There are some bizarre design choices, like the 'consecutive harvest' feature. In short, if you want to get high scores for your harvests you need to rack up multiple harvests beforehand for no apparent reason.The UI is awkward and unclear especially re movement speeds and noise as well as visibility (apparently using a controller is the best way to play, unacceptable for a PC game).Bugs are frequent, although the developers are working hard to iron them out, however as plenty of other reviewers have stated, the game should not have been released in the state that it is (or at least, for the price that it is).There is no steam workshop/mod support that I can see. This would be by far the easiest way to start fixing bugs and letting players customise their experience, and is the lifeblood of PC gaming imho that adds years to the longevity of any game.I've really enjoyed the hours I've put in so far, but I'm going to take a break until the game becomes a bit more accessible, otherwise I fear I will just grow to resent it.I would certainly recommend the game, but perhaps err on the side of caution and wait for a sale or additional patches to come out.

content:
Posted: February 21
												I rarely do reviews, but I figured this game with it's current mitigated score could use a straight to the point review, I hope this helps you make a decision.First off a little about me, I'm no real life hunter and this is my first hunting game. I had been interested by the different games that existed before this one, but the general consensus seemed to be that they were all rip-offs, trying to squeeze the players out of their RL money with endless micro transactions and DLC's, etc.This game is gorgeous, they really nailed the outdoors feeling really well. I don't think I can name a game that has more beautiful trees/forests, it looks fantastic and the performance is also very good. I'm running it at high details (not ultra) and it's absolutely amazing and runs smooth on my mid-level gaming laptop (GTX970M, 16 gigs ram, i7 cpu).There are bugs though... LOTS of bugs, but so far, none are game-breaking. Animals sometimes get stuck in trees and rocks... There are bunnies or whatever that do a stupid amount of noise that doesn't sound natural. You can't walk up a 30% incline (approx). Your walking and run speed is affected by your FPS (this is most noticeable in multiplayer, reducing image quality will make you run faster). I could go on, the game kind of feels like it should be a beta or early release, they definitely still had a lot of ironing out to do before calling it gold IMHO, but despite all this, it's still an amazing game.So far, I'm getting my money's worth, there is no doubt, it's a unique experience, I really enjoy it.

content:
Posted: February 26
												Love this game. Quick to load,easy to play and damn hard to get a good kill with noobie gear. Lots of map space, POI's story line and quests. Lots of excitement every now and then. Gameply hunting wise is not linear, so you have no idea how long a low bloodloss  trail will last. You can run for ages after an animal and never get to it or it may just fall few 100m from the shot. Love watching Youtube clips on hunts and their comments / tactics. The main thing is its fun! Not a high stress game. Take advantage of bugs  where animals get sutck, guns and XP is not cheap. You pay for building of hunting lookouts. Ammo is not cheap! Few minor tweaks and it will be perfect. NOTHING beats the view and the fact that you can spot animals miles away! Sound is excellent but need few close-up tweaks.This is MY review, and I think this game is AWESOME!

												How can you release a game this broken after having made the same game (in essence) twice already?https://clips.twitch.tv/DepressedBrightDiscKappaRossIt looks great, has great atmosphere but it has so many bugs in it I should be talking in Starship Troopers quotes.For €30 on a 'released' game I feel somewhat cheated out of my money. Just not a hunting sim.Too much arcade things going on still... if you have seen a few deer, you will have seen pretty much all of them. Antlers all look the same, you cannot zero your gun to distances other than what they implemented in a skill(!) No choose grainload, "Consecutive Harvest", ... it's like a better Cabela game at this point... but that is really it.

content:
Posted: February 24
												If you plan on using mouse/keyboard don't get this game in its current state. If you use a controller you'll have a much better experience. Alot of the rage experienced is form mouse/keyboard users and I am one of those users. Luckily I can use my xbox controller on my computer when needed cuz the regular UI hates keyboard mouse. Besides that for gameplay itself its not too bad. there are some bugs, like I've seen animals stuck in terrain but it makes it an easy kill lol. Doesn't happen often but it does happen. A lot of things in the game have no tooltips or any explanation so sure you can tell me that I received no "integrity bonus" for a kill but without telling me what that is what am I supposed to do with that information?  Also avoid using special ironsights, they are auto unequipped anytime you switch out from holding the weapon which is all the time.  Game is slowly getting patches and it still fun, you can loose yourself tracking animals for ages but this game isn't meant to be a FPS where you lock and load, run into the forest and spray lead across a field and spend the next hour harvesting bodies. The is a patience game, a low key game. And it does that well. I can't wait for subsequent patches as it will make this game so much better. My only concern is if they release pay content before fixing the issues and interface.

content:
Posted: March 25
												Update: It's now been revealed this is in fact a console port, an unfinished buggy console port sold at full price in a beta condition.This is the worst gaming experience I have had in over 20 years of gaming and this is the first game I have deleted permanently from my steam accounts, I am done with this game.Kudos to those who allow themselves to be treated this way, I am not one of them.The forums are run by fanboys who delete and ban people for the slightest criticism of their precious little game, I was unaware people this weak minded existed.So go ♥♥♥♥ yourself AlfTupper, should our paths ever cross in real life the outcome will be very very different of that I can assure you.It beggars belief how this game was released as "game ready", little has been fixed with the patching to date and the unfinished state of this game is apparent every time you try and play, each patch brings with it new bugs to add to the ever growing Big Bug Report Thread, If you're happy to spend £30 to join a Beta program then buy it.This game delivers graphically but is left wanting in all other departments, I suggest you read the current bugs/unfinished features list before buying.http://steamcommunity.com/app/518790/discussions/5/133258092257803156/Flawed AI, stuck animals, disappearing animals, broken caller animations, broken animal animations, missing animal animations, broken tracking, the sound balance and positioning is crude and undeveloped, The UI is an abomination of design and navigation etc, the list is endless and each subsequent patch brings more and more bugs to the game.Deathly silence in the forums from the Devs other than a few token "marketing" style posts, they are happy to sit back and watch the forum fall apart whilst spending most of their time on the review section posting "damage limitation" responses to negative reviews. 1000's of questions are asked but not a single one is addressed by the devs, the "community" is left to argue amongst itself.The forum moderators are hand picked from the original beta testing team so it's pretty clear where their loyalties lie, the forums are bias to the extreme, anyone criticising the game or it's developers are jumped on by the die hard fan base with calls of "cryer" "whiner" or "your computers a potato" resulting in flaming and threads being (conveniently) locked and posts being (conveniently) deleted.I can't for one second recommend anybody purchase this game in it's current state, yes the game looks good, yes it draws you in and immerses you into the environment, then it proceeds to slowly reveal flaw upon immersion breaking flaw to ruin the experience, If your gaming requirements are slightly above average you are in for a frustrating experience, if you like to run around a pretty environment oblivious of the bugs, shooting anything that moves, "high fiving" every kill and taking screenshots you will love it.Until I see active participation in the forums by the devs, I'm considering it a waste of time and energy suggestion improvements, these guys have their roadmap and everybody else is well and truly on it, just like their previous titles, do your research on Avalanche Studios and Expansive Worlds, put the hype aside and take a look at their track record with theHunter Classic, and Primal, these guys have a history of not finishing things.It's too early to give a detailed review because the game isn't yet "game ready".

content:
Posted: February 23
												Ok I have been Playing for only 3 hours, and already I can tell you this game is awesome.  If you love hunting you will enjoy this game. As far as all these people talking about all these glitches I have no clue what they are talking about. I have tried and tried to cause these glitches. The only one I have found is the scope for second shot and the scope is back filling your screen before you could steady a second running shot anyway.  The menu works perfect and if you read it and look through it then you will have no issues getting around in this game. And as for not being able to get animals ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥T!!!!! I have over 10 animals tracked killed and harvested in 3 hours!!!! 3 HOURS! If you can't get an animal did you ever think maybe you aren't doing it correct???? Also as for calls they work almost to well, hear an animal call and call back that they comes straight to you np even on a trot many times. I have a Fox kill many Roe and Fallow deer and also a blacktail from the other hunting area. have not had any animals just disappear on me. But did lose one cause I lost the tracks which is on me not the game glitching. Also remember in hunter classic if you were near the edge of the map and your tracked animal left the map all tracks went away.  I can say this game looks great and works great, Glitches are pretty unnoticeable. Again I spend about 30 min. of my 3 hours trying to make it glitch and to find glitches.  Enjoy the game and dismiss the haters.

content:
Posted: March 4
												Dear Devs and All,  this is an engaging game.  The landscape, weather and environment are really very nice indeed.  It is however currently let down by several issues which affect gameplay and overall enjoyment which SHOULD NOT be in this post beta release.  Namely: you change the music settings to zero and yet it still plays loud music(!)  The interface is very ropey, more often than not clicking or pressing ''escape' on the keyboard to try and leave the interface (settings for example) does nothing >.< grrr.  Deer, indeed herds of deer, caught up running around in circles or up against the landscape ad infinitum.  Walking/squatting or kitten crawling seems to make little change to noise or animals awareness of you.  Gear is so expensive. But lastly the most annoying thing is, it takes ages, absolutely ages to get from one area to another... As has already been suggested - a tent or 'camp for the night' feature would make this all much more tolerable.Cheers!

I have a Fox kill many Roe and Fallow deer and also a blacktail from the other hunting area. have not had any animals just disappear on me. But did lose one cause I lost the tracks which is on me not the game glitching. Also remember in hunter classic if you were near the edge of the map and your tracked animal left the map all tracks went away.  I can say this game looks great and works great, Glitches are pretty unnoticeable. Again I spend about 30 min. of my 3 hours trying to make it glitch and to find glitches.  Enjoy the game and dismiss the haters.

content:
Posted: February 16
												NOT A SHOOTER ARCADE GAME! This is as close to a hunting simulation as you can get. If you want action and unrealistic, blasting away at everything that moves like Duck Hunt; Save your money. However, if you are a long time vet of the original TheHunter game, hunt for real or like the idea of relaxing pace hunting games then you may like it. Getting tired of seeing these people complain about stuff that has nothing to do with the game, but how they play it. I was one of the lucky few to play the orginal before release and continued to play it almost 10 years later. Very challenging and realistic. There are some bugs, but after hours I have yet to experience the sheer horror that some of the reviewers "say" they have experienced. The UI is a little wonky, and Ultra graphics are not optimized. You will have to knock a couple of settings from Ultra to High, but it is nothing too bad. Feels very similar to the original, but does have some improvements as well. Though some of the things I am personally not a fan of, but I won't fault the game for that. I will say this. I do have top of the line hardware. I cannot give an opinion on what the game plays like on a low end system. Though I would imagine your experience may not be the same.

content:
Posted: March 4
												Dear Devs and All,  this is an engaging game.  The landscape, weather and environment are really very nice indeed.  It is however currently let down by several issues which affect gameplay and overall enjoyment which SHOULD NOT be in this post beta release.  Namely: you change the music settings to zero and yet it still plays loud music(!)  The interface is very ropey, more often than not clicking or pressing ''escape' on the keyboard to try and leave the interface (settings for example) does nothing >.< grrr.  Deer, indeed herds of deer, caught up running around in circles or up against the landscape ad infinitum.  Walking/squatting or kitten crawling seems to make little change to noise or animals awareness of you.  Gear is so expensive. But lastly the most annoying thing is, it takes ages, absolutely ages to get from one area to another... As has already been suggested - a tent or 'camp for the night' feature would make this all much more tolerable.Cheers!

content:
Posted: February 18
												It just doesn't make sense to have an amazing looking game crash, and have this bad of a menu system. Here is the break down:The game is beautiful graphics wise when you crank it up to Ultra everything but when there are so many bugs it becomes unplayable.There is only one player profile across the board. What you do online is the same as if you play solo mode. (example: I dropped a gun online, it was gone in single player as well. (I create a New Game, it just resets my spawn point of my other game but I have same items skills etc...)The Menus are just a developers nightmear. They never work and 50% of the game you have to move in and out of the menus to change guns, ammo etc... I found myself using my arrow keys and enter key to navigate, and that only works like 70% of the time, but a little better then clicking with a mouse. MENU SYSTEM MUST BE WORKED ON before you buy!There is no leaving a game! Thats right, you can't leave a single player game or a online player game and go directly back to the main menu... You Exit to desktop every time! So if i am playing single player, and my firend gets online and is like join my game... I have to exit the entire game to re-launch it then go to multi player. Multiplayer is a bit buggy, There lag system is broken. Peer to Peer style play. I was just about to bag a nice buck and bam the host left the game, Here is the kicker, The entire game shuts down, Not a crash it ♥♥♥♥ing shuts down?!?! No ♥♥♥♥s where given!Deer and animals get stuck in rocks and♥♥♥♥♥♥all the time.Single player is way to easy to play, every second there is a sound from an animal or a trailMutliplayer is much more..... its a bit real, animals are harder to find and you need your actual skills to find♥♥♥♥♥♥ I'm not trying to bash this game its just not finnished, its more of a beta then a final game. Don't get me wrong, the game has its ups which would be graphics, I've never seen a deer hunter game look so great in my life. Till the game gets patched with the bugs and suggestions I made above... Its a hard hard pass.

content:
Posted: February 16
												I wish I could give a neutral review. I really wanted a open world hunting game ever since I played one when I was a little kid. Cabela's never did it in recent years so when I saw this I thought ♥♥♥♥ yeah. The only problem was it was by the people who developed thehunter. So I sucked it up watched a couple videos and thought cool little arcadie but I'll still play it.The bugs are astronomical as to what other people have said and to my own experience. - Can't close the menu with escape in certain menus- You can't see waypoints you've set- When you open the map it takes your fov of the map to the outskirts of where you're hunting so you have to scroll back in.  - You can lay prone, crouch or stand up and have deer walk right up to you with nothing happening adding a nice bonus to killing a animal. - I'm pretty sure deer are set to a certain path I scared a couple off once and they kept running away from where my character was then running back to my character.  - If there was melee in this game I'm sure people would prone up to deers and kill them John Rambo style. - The game froze in the menu once for me and I had to turn my computer off to close the game.I wanna keep going but I'll just not recommend this game as it is right now and go to work. I'm going to keep this game also and continue to play it as I liked the idea of this game so far and have been looking for one of these for a while.Edit: New bugs I've found- I haven't been able to replicate it more than 3 or 4 times but after holstering your weapon and switching to the gps after running for a while makes the screen of the gps disappear- When you go to the store to buy things. The items you have unlocked scroll with the menu when you're looking through the store making it difficult to know what items you are trying to buy.Remember my downvote is centered towards *Do you recommend this game?* If someone really wanted a open world hunting game this is the game to get. The bugs aren't terrible enough to stop me from playing.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 25
												Update: It's now been revealed this is in fact a console port, an unfinished buggy console port sold at full price in a beta condition.This is the worst gaming experience I have had in over 20 years of gaming and this is the first game I have deleted permanently from my steam accounts, I am done with this game.Kudos to those who allow themselves to be treated this way, I am not one of them.The forums are run by fanboys who delete and ban people for the slightest criticism of their precious little game, I was unaware people this weak minded existed.So go ♥♥♥♥ yourself AlfTupper, should our paths ever cross in real life the outcome will be very very different of that I can assure you.It beggars belief how this game was released as "game ready", little has been fixed with the patching to date and the unfinished state of this game is apparent every time you try and play, each patch brings with it new bugs to add to the ever growing Big Bug Report Thread, If you're happy to spend £30 to join a Beta program then buy it.This game delivers graphically but is left wanting in all other departments, I suggest you read the current bugs/unfinished features list before buying.http://steamcommunity.com/app/518790/discussions/5/133258092257803156/Flawed AI, stuck animals, disappearing animals, broken caller animations, broken animal animations, missing animal animations, broken tracking, the sound balance and positioning is crude and undeveloped, The UI is an abomination of design and navigation etc, the list is endless and each subsequent patch brings more and more bugs to the game.Deathly silence in the forums from the Devs other than a few token "marketing" style posts, they are happy to sit back and watch the forum fall apart whilst spending most of their time on the review section posting "damage limitation" responses to negative reviews. 1000's of questions are asked but not a single one is addressed by the devs, the "community" is left to argue amongst itself.The forum moderators are hand picked from the original beta testing team so it's pretty clear where their loyalties lie, the forums are bias to the extreme, anyone criticising the game or it's developers are jumped on by the die hard fan base with calls of "cryer" "whiner" or "your computers a potato" resulting in flaming and threads being (conveniently) locked and posts being (conveniently) deleted.I can't for one second recommend anybody purchase this game in it's current state, yes the game looks good, yes it draws you in and immerses you into the environment, then it proceeds to slowly reveal flaw upon immersion breaking flaw to ruin the experience, If your gaming requirements are slightly above average you are in for a frustrating experience, if you like to run around a pretty environment oblivious of the bugs, shooting anything that moves, "high fiving" every kill and taking screenshots you will love it.Until I see active participation in the forums by the devs, I'm considering it a waste of time and energy suggestion improvements, these guys have their roadmap and everybody else is well and truly on it, just like their previous titles, do your research on Avalanche Studios and Expansive Worlds, put the hype aside and take a look at their track record with theHunter Classic, and Primal, these guys have a history of not finishing things.It's too early to give a detailed review because the game isn't yet "game ready".

content:
Posted: February 28
												Though I am not a very good hunter  I still played  the Hunter a fashionable number of hours and enjoyed it very much, even though it had some quirks  and features like micro sales which I find unpalatable but still  it is lush and immensely enjoyable . So when I saw Hunter cotw I thought it would be  a very nice game to buy  and it was at first . I started a new hunter  and learned the rules through the lush wood of Hirshfelden  and grew quite fond of it  then I discovered  problems and bugs such as the animal falling  when hit ,  then starting up  again which prevented me  from  total immersion  animals caught in the textures and keeping running  through, stationarily  but ok  every games has its quirk and I should not complain about it  but still ... This game has a great potential and  is far from reaching it  and Sadly it is embedded in its structure. You have no save... let me explain  You have 2 hunting  territories Leyton lake and Hirshfelden  and you can't  use the same build  of character in the other reservation  worse than that. You'll have to start again in the previous one if you start a new game I was utterly dismayed  when I discovered it . When you  launch a game if you  level up through it  you usually know that your character is going to  be with you even if you start a new one or in the case of The hunter  you don’t lose anything when you start another game. I hope that  I made my point and  would like expensive world to add this particular feature (which is a save mechanism) in order to make the game really enjoyable  and longer lasting. Please consider what I said before buying it It is not a bad game of itself but it is  quite limited Have a good gaming and see you for my next review.

content:
Posted: April 23
												I've held off from writing a review for this game until most of the bugs have been fixed, there are still a few bugs but none are gamebreaking in my opinion.The game is really beautiful, the areas are rendered wonderfully well. It also runs great, even on minimum spec systems, with plenty of options to be tweaked in the graphic settings.If you own a decent spec system (my system is a haswell i5 @ 3.8ghz and a gtx 1080) you can maximise the graphics and even run in enhanced resolution (dsr). I run this game at 1600p and it's stunning and maintains between 45 and 55 fps :)The hunting is fun and rewarding. You start off with a basic .243 rifle and basic ammo. As you harvest animals you get a monetary reward, xp and a score towards your weapon class.As you level your weapon class this enables new ammunition and weapon types to be unlocked, which are paid for by your in game cash.Xp goes towards levelling your character. For each level, up to about level 36, you get either a skill point, or perk point to spend.Skill points are spent towards things like tracking and spotting, using scents etc.Perk points are spent in your weapon trees, to improve things like breath control.All these "upgrades" to your character make perfect sense, after all the more you use a rifle the better you'll get with the weapon.There are four trees for your perk points, a tree for each weapon type.Rifles, Bows, Handguns and Shotguns.This enables you to customise your spec to whatever you get the most enjoyment from using. For me it's bows!The actual hunting is great fun, the tracking system works really well and is better (imho) than in classic hunter.There are two areas to hunt in this game and they are huge with more areas promised as dlc.This game is well worth buying and is gradually getting better, as bugs are ironed out.9/10 for me :)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 11
												Loving the game so far. I have quite a few hours in the original "theHunter" and this game will blow the original out of the water when the bugs and other features are fixed/implemented. It's quite a grind to get what you want but it has me coming back for more. So used to the old game with stats and worrying about how much ammo I need per map. I'm at a low level right now so I don't have to worry about it yet but can't wait for it to be an issue.A couple hours into the game I ran into a herd of Buffalo and only had the .243.... Why not... I was dodging Buffalo for 30 minutes as they kept charging me at random. I definitely know the sounds of disgruntled buffalo now. 6 shots by the way... How many .243 rounds it takes to take down a single buffalo while dodging several and you can't shoot straight because you're stamina is so low from trying to get away.Based on playing theHunter:Pros:1. No micro transactions2. Killer graphics. I find my self running around just to look at all the scenery.3. Easily track animals. The tracks glow a certain color and pulsate.4. Chainsaw background noise in the distance was a nice addition. 5. Doc doesn't scold me anymore.6. Sounds meter shows you how loud you are.7. Windage is shown (direction) for free. 8. Caps lock is the move faster button. You can move faster in crouch position too.9. Map doesn't reset at nightime and there's a flashlight.10. Nightsights.11. Visibility meter always visable. No need to go to huntermate to check.Cons:1. No micro transactions - theHunter (original) could buy anything you wanted when you wanted it (real money)... Love hate relationship.2. Crashes quite a bit right now but I'm sure it will be fixed soon.  A. Alt tabbing out crashes for me.  B. Crashed when I shot a huge deer. It ran around in circles for a min then the game crashed. Sad I didn't get the points for it.  C. Tried changing the resolution and the game crashed.3. Can't shoot the rabbits. I know that will be coming as it was in the original.4. No mallard or geese... :(5. I don't like the animals scared stat. I run around to sightsee and have a bad stat because of it.6. Not that much documentation to know what you need  A. What camo is good for the area you're in. Scent/noise reduction? Just for looks right now?  B. Should I waste my credits on the .223? What can I shoot with it? Just the red fox? Rabbit for no points?7. Can't reload weapon while running or in crouch fast position.8. Music sound setting is reset after harvesting an animal. Good sounding but cann't hear the animals too well at 90.9. Could be my computer but the clickable areas are off in windowed mode. For example, you have to click 1/4" below "buy" to click the link.10. Glow sights are taken off weapon when you switch to something other than that weapon (very annoying). Scopes seem to stick and don't have any issues.11.Occasionally when pressing the "d" key, you'll crouch and the only way to get out of it is to go prone and get back up.Is there a link to the game roadmap (what developers are working on)?Don't get this game if you want to just jump into the game and shoot animals. You could be walking around the map for 15 minutes and not see/hear an animal. If you like hunting and are patient, this is the game to get.

content:
Posted: February 16
												Okay. TheHunter: Call of the Wild™...is it any good? ehm...yes, it is...BUT, and this is the BUTTEST of BUTS, it could be great and it isnt right now.It is buggy. The controls and the menu's are doing weird things all over the place. The challenge is okay. Sneaking up on deer has not become TOO easy. Landing a good shot is still something that takes practice. However, there are a reasonable amount of animals around and they are not as easily startled as in the TheHunter classic. This is an understandable choice, given the different game mechanics, but it takes some getting used to.All in all, the gameplay could use some finetuning, the bugs definitely need to be FIXED as quickly as possible (it is a disgrace that the product is so buggy), but the game is generally fine.And this brings us to the best feature of the game. IT IS GORGEOUS. absolutely gorgeous. If you are like me and you spent many hours into TheHunter classic, you are probably okay with how the old game looks. Not great, but it works and it stills conveys the idea of a realistic hunt. But this is a new level of looks. the foliage and the grass bending away when you walk through out, the light breaking through the trees. It is so beautiful and gives a whole different esthetic to the game. Just yes. In this case, I would say, trust that the developers will fix the things that need fixing. They are a very community oriented bunch and they do listen to what the community says. If that happens, if the bugs get fixed and the gameplay finetuned, we have a mighty fine hunting game on our hands. Buy it. It works.

												Huge disappointment - even though there are plenty of good things to say about this, the core mechanics are very flawed and the learning curve is more weird then the Hunter Classic. Pro's:Graphics are excellent, love the foilage and the animals, good variety in terrainA different approach, with several ways of balancing your own style, a good progression ideaHUGE world, lots to see and unlockGood difficulty in animals behaviorCon's:Starting area is so wrong, VERY dense, very frustrating that most animals are spooked before you even see themDifficulty is backwards. And since getting exp and kills are quite difficult without skills - go figure, you spend the first hour doing nothing but chase air...Shooting mechanics are way off. A point blank shot to the chest can leave you with a "flesh wound" and without a shooting range, i can figure out what im doing wrong or how my aim is off... The kills i get, dont make me much wiser, but there is a significant amount of bullet spread.Trophies and the hunting experience is arcadish. The trophy shot is just an x-ray of your shots and numbers. Big disappointment!Clearly already setting out for several DLC's - birdshot but no birds ingame... Come on...The tutorial is pretty useless. You have to dig on your own to figure out things in the codexUI and inventory is still pretty messy and often quite buggedMissions are still bugged even the same ones as in closed beta in december...I simply cant recommend this untill mayor improvements have been done, even though this is way better then the arcade shooters/hunting games.Should have been early acces or beta, doesn't seem finished

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
												Alright the game has been out for just under a week and i already have >20 hours time played.  This is a great follow up theHunter original - i would say if you enjoyed that game and your computer can handle the new engine then you will also enjoy Call of the Wild.  The environment and graphics are incredible.  The sound stage is great.  The improvments to draw distance were so needed and really breathe new life into Call of the Wild (draw distance was why i stopped playing the original game).  Overall there are a few glitchy things but i think the devs still deserve credit for a solid release.  Reading through some of the other reviews and discussions i think some people are definitely blowing the issues out of proportion.  I can recall a number of AAA titles with a $60 price tag in the last year that have had far far far worse bugs (i.e. AAA titles with actual game breaking bugs: falling through maps, blue screen of death, etc.) and i have not experienced anything even remotely close to that magnitude with theHunter.  There are a few hiccups in the menus (both start and in game).  The animal UI is suitable for now but also has some opportunities around movement patterns, behavior on steep terrain, and fleeing.Sure, there are a couple of things that need to be ironed out but the potential is CLEARLY here.  I have already gotten more than $30 of enjoyment out of the game over the first weekend.  I'd love to see some refinement to the bow hunting in the future, some additional stat tracking, and the inclusion of ATVs for getting around faster than walking.
