number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16
												As someone who has almost 300 hours in Thehunter: Classic this game is pretty much an upgrade to that game. The graphics and atmosphere are fantastic. Night hunting is a lot more tense than anything in Classic ever were. Took me first hour to get used to the keys and set my mouse and stuff but after that I was fully immersed in the game. Stalk hunted some roe deer and fallow deer and even a very hard red deer! So atmosphere, graphics and general feel are good.Animals are pretty realistic. Tracking is a lot nicer than in Classic and it feels more natural. You can find animal in every corner if you get lucky but for my first hour I didn't even see more than one so it can vary. Each animal give you score, experience and money. Score is based on the animals size and antlers, how quickly you killed the animal, did you use the right weapon and bonus from previous animal harvests. Each animal also has a rank from very easy to mythical. The harder the animal is, the better reward it gives when harvested.New equipment and weapons are bought with money earned in game from kills and missions. Most of the stuff are locked behind a level or a score so you need to play the game to unlock them. I don't know if I like this or not yet. Need to play more to see how fast can level up and gain money and score to determine if it's a grind to get them all.Haven't done many missions yet but so far they seem to be reasonably well designed. You can activate multiple and do them while you explore and hunt. Gives extra cash and experience and shows you around the maps, which is pretty great.So far the best thing about the game has been exploring. Maps are beautiful and full of stuff to discover. I was taking screenshots left and right all the time. It's a really, really beautiful game and sound design just enhances that feeling.the UI is pretty horrible to be honest. Inventory is a mess and pretty unclear. Huge icons on the screen for tracks and calls. You can't see your own waypoint in the huntermate until you are 100 meters away from it. Makes the navigating a bit challenging when you need to open a map to see where you are going. Luckily you can turn most of those things off so that's a plus.Most bugs that I ran into were sound or animation bugs. Background music in outposts is very loud. Animals can get pretty easily stuck on rocks when fleeing. Jumping and walking uphill is a drag. Somehow I lost almost all my health by jumping. The game ran smoothly on high/ultra with my machine (i7-2600, 16gm ram, gtx 970).TL;DR If you liked TheHunter: Classic but don't want to pay montly fees and you own modern gaming PC, this is the game for you. If you have never played a hunting game then I'd say this is a pretty good game to start with. I didn't find it that hard until I was chasing a mythical fox in the night which was impossible! The game will be updated and bugs will be fixed so if you are concerned about those then keep an eye and wait for bugs to be ironed out. If you want the best and most beautiful hunting experience available right now, get this game. It's fantastic at what it does.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 18
												The game runs fine for me performance wise. The game runs smooth as can be on high settings on a 7 year old rig, and it looks amazing. However, the bugs are real. The dev team is already making progress fixing the wonky menu and the many ingame bugs though, so props to them for that, but this stuff really should have been ironed out before release, especially after getting beta tester feedback. As for the gameplay itself, it has lots of really nice features that make it really enjoyable. My favorite little thing so far that I have noticed is that animals make their own trails while traveling through the landscape. They crumple the grass they walk on, break branches they move into, etc. leaving visible trails. However, the game is missing some stuff from classic that would really help the immersion. TruRacs, the feature that gave every single animal on the map a unique rack of antlers, seems to be the feature people miss most of all (Doesn't bother me much at all, but I'm a fisherman first and foremost IRL, so I'm used to one species of animal looking almost identical, other than size, everytime I bag one). This experience is also much more casual. As soon as you spawn into the map you will be spotting animals left and right. It almost feels like one of those farms that rich people who know nothing about hunting, but just want to shoot something, go to hunt. Not necessarily a bad thing, especially since this is a video game. Just something to keep in mind for you hardcore hunters.Basically, the way I see it is: If you don't like the subscription based payment option of theHunter classic but still want a similar hunting experience, or just want to take a break from classic and try something a bit different, then this is the game for you. However, if you don't mind paying for licenses in theHunter classic and are perfectly happy playing that game, you will probably be better off just putting the $30 you would use to buy this game into gear for classic instead, and leaving this one alone for now until it gets some needed polish and more features are added. You aren't missing a whole bunch here except for improved graphics. As someone who doesn't mind paying for a theHunter membership, I find Call of the Wild enjoyable, but I'm not sure how long it will keep my attention before I just go back to playing theHunter classic.

												While I do recommend this game, I will have to stress that people should hold off on purchasing it for a little while.Personally I didn't notice all the same bugs that all these people are talking about, maybe I don't have a good eye, maybe I'm just lucky.I, myself, adore the sounds, the atmosphere, the way the game looks and feels, it's just such a calm world and a good step into the beauty of nature, perfect for people trying to get out of super hardcore shooters and maybe relax a bit with some good ol' fashioned hunting.Frankly I don't much care that you have to have experience built up with certain weapon classes in order to acquire better equipment and then have to rack up a bunch of money all the same, but I guess that's just their way of asking you to actually put a bit of time in before you get all nuts with your gear. I'd say give it a month or two before grabbing it.

Posted: February 18
												Do not be alarmed about all of the negative reviews.I'll rate the game off of graphics, optimization, and gameplay.Graphics 9/10. The graphics are stunning and a direct upgrade from theHunter classic. Sometimes you'll find yourself just standing there and enjoying the view.Optimization. 8/10. The minimum graphics card for this game is a GTX 660. I am currently using a GTX 750 TI and I'm running the game as fine as an ocean wave. However there are some bugs and issues that can make an annoyance; for instance, when I got a mission where I had to take a picture of an animal, the key for taking the picture was unbinded and I missed the chance twice, it was tedious really. The settings menu and UI in-game is a bit buggy as well. But I expect these issues to be fixed in the coming weeks.Gameplay 7.5/10. Tracking, hunting, and killing your first deer is quite satisfying really. However I did have some issues with the animals AI; for instance, There was a deer that did nothing but run in circles around me. It was humorous but annoying. I tried to put the deer out of it's misery but it just kept running as fast as it could. I ended up putting three rounds into him sadly, I aimed for his heart twice but the bullet seemed to just evaporate before it met it's target. I finally scored a penetrating shot and it got stuck on a tree and stared at me for a minute and then fell over. The AI in Call of the Wild™ is kind of an upgrade to theHunter Classic. There are actually feeding and drinking areas that animals will go to and you can sit there and wait for them to show up and take a trophy, but they are a bit buggy sometimes.      Another thing that stunned me was the map. Currently in Call of the Wild™ there are two maps: Hirschfelden and Layton Lake District. Hirschfelden is a map from theHunter Classic but the catch about this is that the map has been expanded by three times the size it used to be. The maps in theHunter Call of the Wild™ are enourmous and if you're in a multiplayer lobby and feel like hunting alone, you can go anywhere and everywhere. Finally this is important that you read this if you didn't like theHunter Classic.Are your ready for this?Are you sure?Ok here we go.THERE ARE NO MORE MICRO-TRANSACTIONSYOU DO NOT NEED TO BUY A MEMBERSHIP OR LISCENSIS TO HUNT IN CALL OF THE WILD™THIS IS A GOD SENDTHANK YOU EXPANSIVE WORLDSFor a total overall reveiw. I'll give it a 7.5/10The game is amazing, the bugs are the major drawback.If you don't wanna buy the game because of the bugs, that's ok. Just check back in the next few months for updates that fix these.I'll edit this reveiw when the bugs are sorted out.EDIT: UI ISSUES SEEM TO BE FIXED. IGNORE EVERYTHING I SAID ABOUT THE UI.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19
												   Wow.  Where to begin?  First off, this game was not ready for release.  I've been on The Hunter Classic from the start, the 75th person to join it.  There have been a number of issues with that game, but it's at least a decent game.  Too many bugs here to mention and finding new ones every time I play.  Today my binoculars just disappeared.  My Roe Deer call no longer has an audible sound, but still attracts deer.  Auto walk also changes what I'm carrying, sometimes, sometimes not.  Sometimes I can use my key bindings to change in use items, other times I have to go back to my huntermate and then to the weapon or call I want.  Now, today, I find that most of my prvious progress in Layton Lakes has disappeared.  I have no way to access a previous game, only to select a new game or continue the last game played so when I left Layton Lakes and went to Hirschfelden, I lost most of my progress at Layton Lakes but kept access to the outposts I'd reached.     One of my greatest pet peeves about The Hunter Classic was how every time I'd hop in for a quick game, it seemed there was a patch to download, time to play was wasted on updates.  This game had an update on day 2 and looks like there will need to be any more.Pros:    Great graphics.  Water puddles form when it rains.  Good thunder sounds.  Animals look excellent up close.Cons:     Too many bugs to count.  No purchaseable content.  (I would like to see some DLC for $ in addition to earning points for those who lack $)  Plays slow despite having a fairly powerful computer (4.2 Ghz hexa core processor).  Too many carry overs from Classic (I for one, would like to see a lot fewer of those lame 2d birds and instead have had a few well placed, well thought out 3d songbirds, maybe a rare bald eagle soaring over Layton Lakes)    Great idea, bad execution.  Hopefully they fix this one unlike The Hunter Primal.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19
												I'm a big fan of the classic theHunter game and was pretty excited when I saw the trailers for Call of the Wild. Unfortunately, in it's current state the game is subpar. Even if we ignore the bugs that are currently in the game (no sneak for non-controller users, buttons not working and graphics and settings resetting), the game still doesn't compare to theHunter classic. Firs of all, the animals are everywhere, and the AI is stupid, blind and will ignore a player 2ft from them. No challenge. Lot's of times the animals will be stuck in terrain and you can run up to them and pop them from point blank range. I've read that for a lot of people the game has frequent crashes and is unstable, however I have only experienced one crash in ~10 hrs in.Now onto the good parts of the game: The visuals are great, landscape, weather etc feels really nice and immersive. Sounds are pretty good too, if not a bit loud. (can probably be adjusted in menus). The starter weapon is pretty good, as it was in classic, and you won't need to upgrade it for a while if you manage to place your shots correctly. I haven't had too many issues dropping white / blacktail, roosewelt elk or black bears. Haven't tried moose yet.The devs seems to be adressing bugs and patch the game, and I do have faith in them, but overall I think you should stick with theHunter classic a while longer if you want a genuine hunting sim. As it stand, theHunter: Call of the Wild is too arcade for my tastes, although some people will enjoy this. I will recommend this game, but if you want an upgrade from theHunter classic; this is not it just yet.

Posted: February 17
												I'm an avid player of theHunter and was excited for this release, but I have to warn everyone to NOT BUY THIS! In its current state it's completely broken. There are dozens of glaring bugs which cause crashes, inability to join friends in multiplayer, animals glitching into terrain, the server browser not working correctly and many more issues.On top of that there are issues which are just terrible design and should be patched out immediately. There is no option of exiting a single player/multiplayer game to the main menu, you have to quit to desktop and reboot the game. The Lake District map is literally crawling with deer, it's like a shooting range. Animals don't appear to react to gunfire unless they've been hit with a bullet, you can shoot 6 deer without the others in the herd caring.Wait and see if they fix the game with patches before considering purchasing this.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16
												From a developers standpoint I am sure it is impossible to test every setup for every type of computer, and clearly many devs wait for the feedback from buyers to get rid of operational bugs for some rigs, (if the buyers are sharp enough to send their specs to the deves so thay can be patched). It seems that many times though a negative review is given for an outstanding game because it does not work 100%, (as it should!). I don't consider my system a super system, but I have NEVER had any game fail to work properly for me, and I own a lot of games. This one is particularly grating, as the negative reviews are hammering things that I have not seen, and do not experience. All I have had is a fantastic time, so far, playing this exceptional simulator. No glitches, no problems with the menus, the animals are spaced out and seem to behave within realisitic limits. All of the tracking aids can be turned down or off, for realism's sake. The graphics and atmosphere are exceptional!    I am giving this title an enthusiastic thumbs-up, and I have never played the "classic" version, (I have a strong adversion to free games that pay as you go..no thank-you :)  )  If whatever your system is meets the requirements give it a go if this type of simulation at all interests you. I hope you would be as satisfied as I am.

content:
Posted: February 16
												So it's not the early access.Although it feels like it is.Here's what I've got: on the first try:


Although there's 4:3 ratios resolution, not everything of the interface fits in the screen. I call it poor planning. 
A Screenshot of theHunter™: Call of the Wild
By: Licopolis







Deep personalisation of a character. gender and "skin tone" which is actually whole "character model" 
A Screenshot of theHunter™: Call of the Wild
By: Licopolis




The game is very hardware-dependant, so I had to tweak graphics settings in the middle of an intro. Guess what I've got? Menu closing button didn't work, and the only option to quit that menu was quitting to desktop.UI doesn't fit in 4:3 ratio screen.Sounds start missing randomly (not all of them but frequently animal calls, callers and footsteps).Starting new singleplayer game doesn't reset your ammo. So effectively you could waste all and then start from scratch with 0 bullets in the middle of nowhere. Some players have reported buying option is not working for .243 - I'm yet to test it.Just've seen tech issue reported by some lucky XB controller user: "keyboard users cannot sneak", Brilliant.Finally (that's what I asked for refund after) I started a new game in Lake District. I had quit the game after getting stuck in the textures and met empty main menu on restarting, meaning it has become totally unplayable.I now understand why they haven't started with pre-order. I can just hope that some day bugs will get fixed and game will be redesigned.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 18
												It's almost a shame that I love this game so much.. It's a beautiful game, with atmosphere out the wazoo... But as per usual with new games these days, there are issues..  I would love nothing more than to say "I recommend this game"... These kinds of games have always fascinated me, and theHunter:CofW is no different. And it performs well.But it has to be a "No" on recommending it. And here is why;1: No ultrawide support. Menus and popup boxes end up outside the screen along with ammo count etc. But I did end up lowering the resolution and got to play it like that. Shame really, it's 2017 after all.2: Random UI malfunctions. Suddenly you are standing there without weapons, or any of the other dibs and dabs you are carrying around with you. And no matter what you try, nothing happens. At first I thought I had holstered the weapon, but no... The weapon, nor lures or anything else works at that point. And then you have the blinds that you are unable to interact with (suspect this has more to do with the interact prompt being outside of the screen relestate, but I have had this running it at 1920x1080 as well... so perhaps not.3: Random game crashes. The game ran fine up til Scheenberg (or whatever its face), but after I made it there I have had three crashes putting me back to the previous camp, ending with me having to try to track up to the camp up there just to get a fast travel point, but so far I have had three of these crashes without making it to that darn camp :(As always, your milage may vary, and if you dont have any of these problems: Congratulations! Like mentioned I'd love to recommend this game, but in its current state my suggestion would be to wait. I have my fingers crossed that they will infact be able to fix it, in which case its going to be a "Yes" instead of the "No" it currently stands at.In either case, I'll continue to try to get to that damn camp a little longer, so wish me luck!Edit: Good news everyone! Made it to the camp! And not had another crash after that. Fingers crossed for being allowed to play more.

content:
Posted: February 19
												The thought of a realistic hunting game was what made me buy this game. And Although they did a decent job at creating a wide open world with beautiful animals and nature in it, they failed to keep the player in mind designing the mechanics. Walking around is horribly slow (as is the general way of doing things like putting the binoculars to your eyes) and stalking an animal feels a bit like you're being toyed around. With only some blue highlighted tracks and droppings to look for, you're just hoping that at some point the actual animal will appear. Even more so, the game still is quite glitchy and off in weird ways. My first kill was from point blank range on a deer that was glitching out against a rock. Not the best way to get your first kill right?!I get the whole realistic approach for this game but it just couldn't keep me entertained for more than an hour or three. After only 24 hours, I had to conclude that this has to be one of the worst buys of recent years.... Refund please...

												Stunning, astonishingly beautiful, gorgeous, mind blowing visuals.Performance is perfect, a smooth 82fps + (For me at least)If you enjoy patiently stalking your prey and travelling on foot across a massive landscape, then you'll love this game. A few glitches with the interface, when changing equipment and doesn't play perfectly with a controller. But other than that, it's spot and is so worth the £29.99 price tag.Awesome.

As well, when u zoom in and shoot with your first ability that you can shoot a 2nd shot your scopr seems glitched out and in again. Not smooth at all.in Multiplayer the walking animations are horrible the legs are glitchy as f* I've finally found a rare dear (albino) with white fur. Shot it, and wanted to ahrvest it. Game crashed. great :) well.. not at all. I mean please guys, this game is FAR better than the "TheHunter" with the 350$ microtransactions. But why do I can't watch my trohpies? why is there still a bug that Deers cant be shot through leafes... I don't know, I really enjoyed thisa game for about 3hours even with some crashes but now im kinda in this moot. Fix this game or it will be a placeholder in my libary... sad to say. could be such a great game.

												I cannot understand how a game with as many issues as this one gets a full release.I am aware that the game is still undergoing patches as I've followed it before purchasing but some of the issues I've noticed seem like they should have been taken care of before release.Like the Game controls not saving properly. Reverting back at times during play.Some other issues I've noticed is the headlamp will not turn of when I tap the default L key. The light just flickers.It auto turns on at a certain hour and upon daylight it seemed to stay on until I hit the L key again at that point it turned off. Seems that in the night time I cannot turn it off.But what brings me to downvote this as of right now is my issue with the flesh wound animal tracking.Tracking a flesh wounded animal, just to find the trail dead ends and the animal disappearing. The two times I've experienced this was when I flesh wounded a Fallow. Both times in daylight.Tracked for about 20-30 minutes both times to come to a dead end trail with no animal.Waste of time and gamebreaking.Until this is fixed, thumbs down.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22
												This game is frustrating, slow, difficult, and exactly what someone would want from a hunting simulator! This game is not a salt-lick simulator. It takes time to travel around the map and to explore different areas. It takes time to track down animals and sometimes you can go fifteen or twenty minutes without seeing any huntable game. The environment is one of it's greatest features. If you're crawling you will have trouble seeing over the grass, and if you're standing you'll be easilly spotted. The storms that come are amazing. The sounds are incredible even if they don't always match perfectly (warning call vs mating call). There are a few bugs such as animals behaving erradically. I'd say 95% of the time it is bug free and an amazing hunting simulator. I've never had any lag problems or frame loss. I've listed my pc specs belowSpecs: 4.2ghz 8core amd, 16gb ddr3 2133, gtx 960 2gb.

content:
Posted: February 21
												I'm a fan of The Hunter Classic, to me it's a great game and i love it.Now The Hunter : Call of the Wild is a whole different thing, it is gorgeous you can play very casual and still enjoy it alot there's quite some content to play, the details, the animals, the maps, the cabins, the "historical" or points of interest, hunting towers, and to me the most amazing thing is all these things with the sound and music put together, The Ambiance is breathtaking.Now there are many many thing in need of improvement, tweaks, and further developing. I do agree with people when they say this should have been in Early Access, it SHOULD.To me things that need work are.► Game needs to be optimized, i think there is ALOT of room to improve in this particular subject► Animals need improving in their behavior, I didn't play the game enough to be sure, but so far i've noticed that animals tend to wander towards you if you stay still. ► I LOVE the sounds in this game, but there is a particular sound that bugs me, it's when animals go through thick bushes or tree ramifications,  it sounds like a "ZIP" sound, 


YouTube™ Video: Zipper Noise Sound Effects 

			Views: 13,306		

			The sounds of zippers.		

 something like this its very weird. it just make the same sound as you the hunter fully clothed rubbing on these bushes.► The AI needs huge work, it's clunky and bugged.► Also i think the UI that shows when you harvest an animal could have additional info when you hover the mouse above some of the stats, to let you know what the score is for, it would be beneficial for New Players to know what the numbers mean.That's it i really hope they listen to the community (IMO the team behind The Hunter Classic is pretty good with regular content updates and bug fixes) so if CotW team is as good we should have the game much more steady in some time.Please don't scew this up :D

content:
Posted: February 27
												Absolutely fantastic game. Enviroments are beautiful. Weapon handling is smooth. My game runs absolutely stable (unlike most of these negative reviews, I actually know how to BUILD a quality pc). I run Arma 3 ultra and get 50-60 fps. This game doesnt even come close to taxing my system. But it sure just look like it should. I've seen ONE deer get stuck on a tree and bushes..that's less than I've seen IRL. lol seriously. I can't FIND a glitch in this game. Its smooth.This game makes the the first one look like a $5 indie game. Open world is truly open and the regions are massive.The ONLY complaint I can think of is the cost of upgrades in game. You'll have to lay out plenty of animals before you get the more desired of rifles.This game is underhyped, atm. Majority of negative comments are coming from plebs playing on emachines.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16
												Its okay so far. looks nice on my 2 year old MSI gaming laptop (i7, GTX970m, 1080p). Looks really fuzzy when moving through foliage but when standing still it looks amazing. Noticed that you cant adjust the AA? Why? Also, my GPU is only running at about 50% utilization, 53fps on max/ultra but is hitting 84*c... thats not right. normally it stays in the 75*c range and hits 100% utilization when playing other games.I have theHunter classic and the in game world looks pretty much the same, minus the fuzziness. (im not talking about the UI or menu options, just the game world)I purchased just to support the team. Im sure they will fix the issues in no time.EDIT***Im going to be honest... theHunter classic looks about 90% as good and its really old. The only real difference is the GUI and menus. (they suck balls by the way in the new game) The graphics look REALLY close if you compare the two side by side. After palying for about 16 hours now I have seen a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of bugs and issues... (really bad fps  when it rains, animals dont spook corectly, blood trails vanish without a trace, skill/perk points, money, and xp keep poping up after harvesting but dont really have them... and many others people complain about) The only thing I dont see is the crashing. But it does run SUPER hot! (84*C even with a laptop cooler) And thats at only 50% utilization so something is waaay off.Edit #2 Bugs are just getting worse and worse. Lost all of my progress... all my money, skills/perks, weapons... everything. Had to start over even though I didnt want to. Such bullsh!t.

content:
Posted: March 11
Pros:-Very nice graphics and two very large maps. Clearly most of the work has been put into these.-A bit hard at first, but a fairly balanced hunting experience overall-Quest system gives you something focus on besides just wandering the forests.Cons:-A lot of very annoying bugs in basic things as menu, settings, inventory. Really amateurish.-Inventory is very clumsy and confusing. -Gameplay bugs such as animals getting stuck, tracks not showing, scopes bugging out, etc.5/10 game due to the boat load of bugs that require you to relaunch the game every 30 minutes to a few hours.

Posted: March 24
												Great game even thoug I had a very rocky start. For the bad part first, this game would constantly crash on me every 5-90 minutes, I had changed from ultra to lowest possible graphics settings to no avail. After the latest patch I thought the developers would fix this problem. Well still constant crashes. So I decided to go another route, and look a bit more at my hardware. I installed a utility that came with my graphics card, and lowered the clock speed down and limited the temperature, LOW AND BEHOLD success!!, So I looked further and noticed the graphics card was getting a bit high, not really out of the norm for cards nowadays though. A little further testing and I ended up changing the speed of my GPU fan to aggressive. This game is now rock solid on ULTRA setting and getting over 30fps. So just a note to others about crashes, you may want to look in your own backyard a little like I did.NOW FOR THE GOOD. I'm not a hunter at all in real life. But this game is relaxing and fun. I really like the missions as they get you motivated to explore and as they progressivly get harder it takes more concentration and patience. I'm glad that I get to enjoy the game now without the fear of a crash, so I can take my time esploring and looking for outposts, and other POI's. I'm only level 20 but I'm having a great time. Keep in mind that I got 70+ hours in this game even with the constant crashes I had previously, that has to mean something! I can't wait to unlock more items to play around with. I thought bow hunting would be hard but I was happily suprised that it was not a whole lot harder than a gun. I can't wait to see how far my lonest shot will be eventullay and what kind of trophy kills I can get. So much to do. :)I want to thank the developers of this game and I can't wait to see further improvements and DLC's in the future.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16
												A great improvement on TheHunter Classic. The graphics are better, the sounds are better, the environment is better, and the animals are better - especially the rabbits hiding in the underbrush. It's just better. There are also visible trails of bent grass where the animal you're tracking travelled, which is awesome and makes tracking much more intuitive than the search patterns you probably learned to do in theHunter Classic, and the render distance isn't capped. That's right you can shoot out beyond 200 meters now - there's even a 400m kill achievement!At release the menus are pretty clunky, but you can work with them. I haven't experienced any major bugs except having to switch to the map screen to exit a menu. Once they patch it up this will be a solid title.If you're a stalker-type hunter, like me, you'll probably want to know that if you use a controller with analog sticks there is a range of movement speeds that will allow you to move while walking and crouching without alarming nearby animals. If you use a M+K setup only the WASD keys have you moving at maximum speed and you'll alarm the animals even when crouching. I use an Xbox One controller to stalk then switch to my M+K to shoot because aiming with a controller is way too hard. Hopefully the devs add a movement speed toggle for M+K, but until they do stalking is really only possible with a controller.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
												Ok so after watching a dozen  review videos about this game I just had to get it. Now I'm going to say this as a real life hunter I tend to play hunting games as I would hunt in real life. Now after saying that this games visuals are stunning. The mechanics are a little wanky at times but with some patches and updates I feel like this will be the best hunting game out there. The animals AI is great for example. I on my first play through which you have to spot track and kill and animal I spotted a Fallow Buck through some brush. Now I was downwind so he did not smell me but I did hit into a branch while getting closer. The Fallow Buck heard it and looked right in my direction before taking off. Thats what happens in real life. I spotted it a 2nd time and was able to get the kill. After that i did not realize i was play for almost an hour. I Think this is going to be a great game. Here are some Pro's and some minor Cons about the game. Pros: Stunning VisualsAnimal AI is great No more P2P (in  game money system when you level up and get cash from killing animals) Perk SystemHuge MapConsWhen you crouch the sound meter stays high but this will be patchedNot enough different speices ( a game update will prob have more) I would like to see treestands and decoys etc. prob in an update. No Trophy Camera pictures. (my Favorite thing about the orginal hunter. I have had no issues with crashing or anything i have seen in other reviews. I recomned this game to anyone who likes to hunt and is a fan of hunting games. The game is a week old they will def do updates to it down the road look at the Hunter 8years and still do patches and updates.  and you can go wrong for $30.

content:
Posted: April 24
												Recently I have been questioning if I actually enjoy most of the games I play. I thought about what games I actually have fun playing, then theHunter came to mind. It made me think, 'maybe I should really rethink my gaming life..' A friend bought me this, otherwise I might have passed it by. I am not going to mark that I recieved it for free, though.. Nothing is free. We take turns buying each other games. We could both start marking all the games we buy for each other as free and never have to buy a game ourselves ever again. I could then tell my gf that I won't buy any more games for myself, then when she sees games were bought at the end of the month I can say, 'well, technically I didn't buy those for myself. I bought them for a friend who in return bought them for me. Don't worry, my games are free this way, honey!'On a serious note, this game is one of the most immersive games I have ever played. I get chills from the weather system because how realistic it is. Other game Devs should take note.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15
												I really quiet like this game. First let's state the obvious - you will probably not have played a better looking game up to you having played theHunter: Call Of The Wild. The graphics are beyond amazing and make you stop often to just take in the scene and take some screenshots. In no game so far have I seen a more detailed, lush and life like depiction of nature. 11/10 on the graphics for sure.Sound design also is very very good. Everything is athmospheric and blends in nicely with the visuals. Those two things together make for an absolutely beautiful and immersive experience.The gameplay is nice, easy to grasp and challenging. I like that there's progression in terms of levels, skills, perks and equipment. The two available hunting reserves are MASSIVE. Stalking your prey and waiting for the right moment to get the perfect (screen)shot is challenging and fun.A lot of people mention having a lot of trouble with bugs. So far I have been spared by most major issues. The issues I had were mostly minor ones like not being able to click "apply" in the graphics settings (restart of the game fixed it). Or the deer AI being somewhat confused and frantic but most of the time everythings seems to be working as intended.I haven't tried the multiplayer yet but I'm looking forward to it. I hope this game will receive lot's of patches and content updates.

content:
Posted: March 16
												Holy smokes Batman! This game is simply stunning and overwhelmingly beautiful. I have to commend Expansive Worlds on the amazing job with the graphics. The music is very atmospheric and helps to take you into the immersion of the game. If you are at all a fan of hunting simulation games or the real thing this is a no-brainer. It's an amazing game to destress to in comparision to something like Counter-Strike or Battlefield as well.This is very easy to reccomend with the single time purchase price which I felt was the achilles heel of the original theHunter game.The in game purchase pricing does seem a bit steep especially for ammo but I think that's merely a minor thing considering you can just buy unlimited .243 bullets for free.9/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 21
												As it currently stands, I cannot recommend this product to anybody, I will keep this short and sweet, I don't often leave reviews but I feel I need to in this instance.This game should be early access for the simple fact that it is impossible to play for more than 20-30 mins without a crash the majority of the time and in a game like this, where it often takes 20-30 mins to move from one area to the next, by the time you actually get to a mission or a place where you wish to hunt, the game will crash and you will start right back at your last outpost when you restart the game, which essentially means, you have wasted 30 mins of your time doing nothing.Irrespective of settings, configuration etc, this isn't a user error, this is an error with the game and whilst I understand the developers are trying to fix this issue, the truth is, it should have never been released in this state.If the crashing problem gets fixed then I would be happy to recommend this product as the graphics are sublime and the gameplay is enjoyable (bug and gameplay quirks aside) but I really feel like, at this point, it should be early access and the truth is, should have never been released in this state.

content:
Posted: February 23
												This game is great looking and the sounds are amazing, I have been enjoying walking in around in the forest and really feeling the weather and the ambiance. There hasn't been a new huntig sim in a long while and this game captures the feeling of hunting. But there are quite a few issues that should have been sorted out before release. For example you cant back out to the main menu from in the game, the noise indicator is maxed almost all the time, the quest system is lacking a bit. You want to unlock the better weapons and upgrades but to do so you have to kill a massive amount of animals with that weapon type, which feels very un huntery. You end up just shooting whatever you find which dosn't feel good. The multiplayer experience had some mayor issiues, alot of crashes and there isn't a good shared xp system. If you hunt together and one in you party gets the kill nobody else gets any xp unless they also hit the animal. Well I've still put alot of time in this game beacause it's very fun and relaxing to explore and hunt in the beatiful envrionment Avalanche has created. I just hope they keep working on the game.

												How did they screw this up so bad?All they had to do was take the systems from theHunter and carry it over into the Apex engine and that would have worked just fine but no.No they had to turn it into a Ubisoft game clone complete with lookout towers to unlock hidden sections of the map and then litter the map with pointless unlock points.You want another skill point?Well then you better read this poetry stone because everyone knows reading poetry makes you a better hunter!This is a very casual game made and marketed for a younger crowd and not the typical theHunter player base.The whole experience comes across very shallow and and it feels more like a platform for dlc then a complete game.Pros:+Nice looking thanks to parent company Avalanche Studios Apex engine.Cons:-No tracking skill required.Just click on the first track and follow the blue trail.the direction of the cone is pointless you have a glowing blue line that leads to the animal.-To many animals-Pointless level system.Apparently it takes hours of study before you can use that upgraded set of binoculars.-You can tag (spot) animals with binoculars just like a third person shooter and they will glow blue for you.-No trophy shot system just a silly Sniper Elite x-ray ripoff thats very jarring and out of place for a hunting game.-Cringeworthy mission writing.Hope is a survivalist that has been living off the land for years when something ransacks one of his camps and steals some of his food.With all his tracking skill he still has no clue what type of creature he is dealing with so he calls me for help.Me:Those are boot prints mate.Made by um...a human.Hope:Im glad you came along and helped i never would have made the connection.The bottom line is its a very easy game with no sense of direction that makes me believe it was rushed to meet a deadline and left empty so they could fill it with paid dlc later on.Wait for a deep deep sale.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18
												It's great so far. I was skeptical, like so many others, from both the mixed reviews and the arcadey looking YouTube videos. I've also played the Hunter classic for a long time and have invested many hours in it. I know some of what I'll put here has already been said, but I feel the game deserves another positive review.The main issue that caused me to hesitate on purchasing was the arcadey look. It mainly comes from the videos having every single visual clue turned on, all of which you can disable. If you simply disable the visual audio clues, and change the track clues to just glow and not the bouncy animation - you are basically right back at the Hunter classic in terms of play. You don't even have that cheat mode of seeing the animal call on the pda and then clicking in the area.  You need to determine from sound direction alone where the call came from. These 2 elements basically remove the arcadey feel just by themselves.Not sure of all the bugs people claim to be having, I have encountered only a couple in my 12 hours of play and none of them were that serious. One of them required a restart, but that was after 3-4 hours of straight play with no issues. The tracks disappeared.Graphics look great, it's awesome that the clock just keeps going and you can go all through the day and night if you choose or rest to speed it back up to your desired time. The night time with the moonlight is especially nice.Don't want to keep going on and on, but again, if your main reservation is the arcadey look - it's worth taking a look for yourself to see, I didn't want to pass it up simply based on other's reviews and I'm glad I didn't.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26
												This is my first theHunter game, and right off the bat, i gotta say it's a ton of fun.It does have a couple issues I've noticed in the 3 hours I've played the game, the most pressing is a simple graphical issue after firing the starting rifle where the iron sight splashes onto the screen for a couple seconds. Other than that and some rather thick hit boxes on some objects, it's so far a pretty complete game. Oh, and taking a picture of the fallow deer is a nightmare, it's very finnicky so don't forget to delete the 50+ pictures you'll end up taking to complete the mission.Other than that, I'm impressed with the atmosphere the game provides, both during the day and at night. The sound design is amazing, other than the simple complaint of really close animal calls being quite loud. I haven't had the chance to experience multiplayer yet as I would like to learn more about the game first, but I'll update the review here when I have.

content:
Posted: February 17
												For a first day buyer, this game was for the most part bug free for me. From a man running a FX 9590 with a GTX 1070 on everthing maxed out, this game gives me an about 90+ fps average. I had a little trouble with freezing cache/store menu, aside from that everything for the most part ran smoothly. I recommend you buy the bow and callers and take what you can get. FYI if you are going to hunt with a bow there is just about no way possible for you to get close without a scent eliminator and crawling while prone. I must've scared about ten bear off like that, and don't even attempt going for an elk with a bow, those douches run off before you can get within a 62 mile radius of them ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.If you are ♥♥♥♥♥ing about the price, I would buy it off a♥♥♥♥♥"like" site for the $20-25 they're selling it for instead of the $30.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18
												Let me first say the game does have a lot of bugs in it but the game is very playable. The scenery, how the vegetation moves, the look of the animals are all excellent and top notch. Now I haven't hunted for almost 30 years but the animal behavior in relation to wind, sound, smell etc seems to be very realistic. The main problem I have with the game is a combination of the game crashing, not enough fast travel and the inability to save when and where you want to. Some missions require you to walk a VERY long way, I mean you literally spend 15-20 minutes walking to get there if you don't have a fast travel spot unlocked closed by. Then if your game crashes while you are there, guess what? You get to make that walk all over again. My work around was to spend several hours just walking around unlocking fast travel areas, totally ignoring the hunting until I had a few unlocked. The menu system is also very wonky, like if you go into settings you can't escape out, you have click on another option then hit escape. For me the music also cuts out a lot . But all in all it's a very fun game to play and it's certainly worth the price.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
												The best deer hunting game I have ever played.....Period. As close to actuall hunting as a pc game can get.The large fallow always seem to be hiding in the bush behind all the other does,just like in the real world.In haven't seen a monster yet,but hear them.The fallow grunt in this game cranks and sounds real (wich worries me,as most other deer have crap sounding grunts,meaning they do that in real life,glad I hunt fallow.....lol)PRO's= Excellent graphics,sound,terrain,weapons,perks,SHEDS YOU CAN FIND BLOODY SHEDS!!!!!!!!! I'd have been happy with a shed hunting simulator,so this was the icing on the cake,being able to run around of a night,shooting wildly into a mob of fallow,and find sheds,just like real life....lolCons= Yeh yeh a few minor bugs after download and into it straight away,but my computer is playing it better today than the day I downloaded it.Sounds in callers working,exit menu no problem.Most of the minor stuff has gone for me by itself.If you wound a fallow,and run after it of a night,DON'T blame the AI if it runs off a large cliff,just suck it up and laugh,then go and collect.System i5 6600k             GTX1070Everything ULTRA,as high as I can make it.My system doesn't break a sweat and I'm thinking of going 2k for it when monitors in that range drop in price.Deer season starts here in 2 weeks.This is just the sort of tonic required for the non season times.Trust me.I cannot say enough good things about this game.If you remember Deer Hunter 2005 (and all before it), GET YOURSELF THIS AS THE TRUE UPDATE TO A DEER HUNTING SIM/GAME.No cabela's sh$t here.

content:
Posted: March 7
												This is an amazing hunting game. The ability to track down any prey, or predator (i.e. whitetail and blacktail deer, jackrabbit, coyote, and bear) is quite impressive. The overall graphics, ambiance, sound effects, weather effects, and overall presentation is possibly the best hunting simulator I have ever played. There are no vehicles to use (which is perfectly fine by me) and the map is impressively huge. Animals behave very realistically, in most circumstances. I know that patches and updates will resolve any bugs that occur, which the developers are actively making sure that the game is running like a top and smashing bugs when they are found, etc. Great game in my opinion.

												I do recommend this game because it does have its good sides, open world hunting, bullet drop (Big one for me), Good ammount of game to down. But there are critical flaws, Like multiplayer is absoutely messed up and not worth it, the server host is allowed to fast travel but it's an issue when everyone else needs to walk 3Km to get to the host, multiplayer loves and I mean LOVES to just crash or drop everyone, and weapon variety can use some improvement, like more shotguns, different bows (Like crossbows and speaking of bows the 3rd person model is messed up and doesnt even look right), different shotguns, and some mroe pistols, Then AI needs some improvement, like I had a herd of Roe dear, shot 3 of them, and some of them pretended like I wasnt even there and putting bullets into them, You can buy this game and play it, just stay away from multiplayer until thats fixed. Multiplayer is shameful for a game on final release.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18
												Pros:-Amazing graphics, sounds, animations, and lighting like never seen on a game before. Makes you feel like you are really in the wild!-Ability to turn off things that might seem arcadish like, missions, tutorial help, animal call visuals,  glowing footprints, beacons, etc.-Two huge maps to explore with lots of ambient wildlife and huntable wildlife!-Easy to access photo mode with zoom (press P) to take a lot of beautiful pictures!-Many missions to complete, leveling system to unlock new gear...no more buying gear with real money!-Deer have many variations in racks, and it is still a challenge to find those trophy bucks like in the TH:C-Night hunting!Negatives: -Some bugs, but I have not experienced as many as others seem to have. Also they are working on them often.-Not a big variety of equipment right now, maybe dlc packs in the future?-No waterfowl, upland birds to hunt maybe they are saving this for a dlc also?Conclusuon:If you love the outdoors and hunting or photography get this game!

content:
Posted: February 16
												400+ hours in classic, and I knew this wouldn't be the same. It isn't, but it's still great.Pluses:+still a fun time stalking and killing prey, with a decent challenge level+graphics are acceptable/good+animal animations are excellent, if not a little glitchy at this point.+sound is phenomenal+missions don't get as annoying as I thought they would.+no microtrans like classicMinuses:+they skimped on the textures, or at least the ability to maximize them in game.+lack of stat system to track number of kills/leaderboards etc. This gives it more of an arcade feel, and I think they struck out with this design decision.+hunting without lures is a drag, especially when you're noisy as heck in the bush from the start.FINAL VERDICT:A good game, and one I would recommend. I look forward to graphical improvements/optimization for those with older systems than mine. Also, incorporating the community of hunters at large in game will be what keeps us coming back to this one, rather than burying our collective nerd hunter heads in classic.

content:
Posted: March 10
												TL;DR; Disappointing bugs and instability, but promising game.Let me start off by saying I've played the original theHunter A LOT, before it became the pay-to-play/win disaster that it is now. I played the original right when the game was released and only had one reserve, so I'm very familiar with the basics of the game and the team behind it.That being said, I saw this game being reviewed and was fairly excited as it looked good and seemed to have taken a more mature turn.However, the game in its current state has quite a large amount of bugs that (in my opinion) prevent me from having a fun experience. My main issue is that a lot of these bugs are super simple things that are obvious right from the start, so I'm surprised this hasn't been caught by QA,For example: map marker will never show up in the location you try to put them in. I'm fairly sure this is tied to the fact that the engine doesn't have proper widescreen support (like the original) and scales the UI improperly (circles are ovals for me). Also, if you do place a marker, 100% of the time the marker will not show up currectly in the game until you reset the marker and add it again. Something that's incredibly annoying and it's a mystery how such an obvious issue has not been addressed.Furthermore, the "tutorial" part is... a little bugged? I didn't find any tracks at all, until I was a good mile into a random direction, even though the lady announced "there's a track nearby". I've seen the same happening in a YouTube review of the game, so I'm not alone.There's also voice lines in the wrong order, which is confusing at best.My game also crashed a few times while playing (I refunded the game, so I haven't played really more than 2 hours), which to me is a show stopper. You simply can't release a crashing game in my opinion, and I'm also not the only one for whom this happens.Either way, I can totally see this game being great for some people already that might not have these issues and I'm more than willing to give it another shot in the future after patches are in place, but unfortunately my experience has been very bad so far and can not recommend this game.

content:
Posted: February 20
												This game is overwhelmingly fun, the single player and missions over all are fun and enjoyable.  There is times where it is a little tough, but the road to finishing some missions can be very interesting.This game is a really big (better) upgrade from the previous free game.  The best part is that you unlock weapons and buy them with in-game currency, that's a win in my own opinion.  You can now progress and hunt more things without having to pay more money to do so.I recommend this game and I also recommend bringing a friend along with you, the multiplayer is a great way to have fun with friends and compete to see who can kill the biggest animal.Lastly, you can expect bugs as it's a new game, but the devs are updating it and making it better, you can wait to buy the game if you want to play a game with ease, but if you don't mind a few bugs and glitches that can give you a laugh at times, I'd recommend picking up this game soon.Pros[+] Graphics are amazing[+] Enjoyable game with a lot of missions[+] Multiplayer is fun and not laggy [depending on the host ;)][+] Loads of places to explore currently[+] Devs are working hard to make the game better.[+] A lot of animals to find a kill (they sometimes roam in large groups)[+] Animals can hurt you (you actually have to fear that now, isn't that cool?!)[+] Realistic hunting simulator[+] Skill points and other sorts to make your character a better hunter. (Example; Skill points put towards certain things makes tracking easier)[+] A lot of other things that you should check out!Cons[-] When you play multiplayer you can't interact with monuments, outposts, and outlooks.[-] Some fps bugs, but you can restart the game and you'll be fine.[-] Some interface bugs, but easily bypassable. I can't think of much more cons as this game is really great, I recommend picking it up and bringing a friend along with you! ;)EDIT:I thought I'd add in that the game is a bit time consuming with walking a lot, here is a suggestion.[+] Add some sort of vehicle, like an atv, but nothing to fast, but just something to get you to a place just a tad bit quicker.  It would make getting from one place to another when hunting in certain areas.  Also, make them two seaters or so, that way if you and a friend play you can also let them hop on the back and you can both go and hunt together.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25
												I will start with this.   Many improvements made over the former game.  Micro transactions are not there, which is a thing of beauty.  The game requires you spend time learning to hunt, how to search explore etc.   It would be foolish of me to attempt to review this beyond a "wow looks beautiful"  "I am glad I bought this" currently.  With more time spent I will update my review.      I have not yet encountered any bugs or graphics issues and I find myself constantly staring off into the distance looking at the lighting, listening to the sounds etc.  It is... gorgeous.  Update:Pro: Huge landscape that takes a long while to explore and unlock.   Intuitive marksmanship. Great skill tree. Amazing sound. when the immersion hits, it hits hard. Con:  The audio is really wonky in several ways.   One being tiny critters like squirrels and rabbits etc are extremely loud.  Loud as a full grown man running through the bushes.  While this does not scare the game, it does scare the headphone wearing user. (when  said immersion has hit). Also the audio will just cut in out of nowhere, some aspect that was not there a moment prior.  Sometimes wind, sometimes crackling grasses etc.   Just recently I didnt hear the sound my guns were making.     There is a bug with the weapon sights and they require fidgeting with to equip at times.    There are a number of challenges this game faces, however the devs have been forthcoming and keep us up to date with regard to status of patches/plans.   Overall, I still suggest buying the game as I have gotten my moneys worth out of it already.    LOVE IT

content:
Posted: April 22
												After spending almost 60 hours so far, and going through several patches and updates, the game is still full of glitches. The glitches do not effect the game play much and are minor, but thats no excuse for the release. The current state of this game is at best, of beta quality. Things like blank in game hints that do not go away, equipping newly puchased sites, and lack of weapons/clothing to buy makes this game sub-par. The previous TheHunter game is in way better condition with better content. The best things this game has are the graphics are very nice, and I personly like the way the animals interact within the world. Animals are much more frequent than the previous TheHunter, but not to the point that its boring and arcade like. All in all, this game did not live up to the level of the previous title. To do so, the devs need to have deployable content like tree stands, feeders, trail cams, and more animal species to hunt. Not recommended in its current state.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 27
												Ok, so first of all, i want to state that it is very hard for me to post a review about this game.  The reason being that i have so much to say about it, making it hard to put it all together or organize it into one conclusive review on the game.  I may review this review multiple times and change or add things to it.Moving on to the actual review i would like to say, being a hunter in reality, that this game is trying its best to meet my expectations for a realistic, interactive hunting game. The graphics are absolutely incredible, I can walk almost anywhere on the reserve and either admire the view of far off areas, or simply enjoy the placement of the brush and trees in my immediate vacinity.  I admire this game for its graphic attention to detail.  The graphics are not the only thing i admire, as they do not make or break a game.  The gameplay and game mechanics are impressive as well.  The pause menu in the game impresses me for several reasons. I enjoy the design of the map and how the waypoint placement works (although a problem with previous waypoints interfering with current ones until removed is slightly annoying), the map works well and i like the ability to fast travel between discovered cabins. I enjoy the fact that missions are implemented but not essential.  I enjoy that the devs focused on both main styles of hunting, ambushing and stalking, and the available skills for both styles. I enjoy that with certain skills you actually have to activate them to use them, and that some have a cool down time. Personally i think it makes it more challenging, and makes you think more.  Moving on to the animals in the game... I like the fact that different animals react differently than others.  Not all animals react the same to sight, smell, and sound as others.  Implimenting those differences is attention to detail that i appreciate as a gamer and a hunter.  The only constructive criticizm i can give, is that i hope they plan to add a massive about of different species including different game sizes. An example being multiple small game type animals having their own scoring.  Moving to maps... I truly enjoy the detail put into developing both of the maps.  They are both huge and there are so many different areas to explore and new sights to see.  I have no complaints about the maps that already exist.  The only thing i coult hope for is that they add several more, just as intricate maps, from all over the world with scores of different species for each area.  Overall i think this game is amazing.  It is the game i have been waitng for since Big Game Hunter.  The "Perfect" hunting game.  Although they are onto an amazing start, i think there is always so much more they can add to eventually make this the most amazing hunting experience available without actually going into the woods with a gun.  If i had to add one suggestion to the game... It would be this...  I think it would be an amazing idea to add a trophy room to the game.  It should be a building you have to find in each region.  When you locate this "trophy room", and claim it, it should display a spot on the wall for each species in the area.  Each space should contain a mount of the largest scoring animal you have harvested of that species.  Along with a list of every other animal you have harvested in that species. Every time you harvest a bigger scoring animal of that species, the wall mount should be replaced with that animal.  This game is amazing.  Overall i have no complaints.  I look forward to seeing where this game goes and i am sure that i will enjoy it regardless.

Posted: February 18
												This is my gaming profile with regards to this game:-Not a hunter in RL- have an account of The Hunter classic but never really played it past a few hours because of the pay model.- My computer exceed the recommended system requirement.First of all, this game has by far the best graphically reproduce forest I have ever seen. The graphics are amazing especially during sun set. I only have about 6 hours of play yet but so far on my computer I still have to encounter any major glitches or issues.The game is smooth on very high setting on my computer which makes me believe they might be some hardware compatibility issues to be fix in future patches because a lot of people are complaining about the game being unplayable. Not the case on my computer.Yes there are some bugs, the UI could be much better and there are some animals behavior that are arguable but nothing that can't be fix. Overall I have seen a whole lot worst than that for launch. It is not a perfect game but it is half the price of a full AAA game, the developers are listening to us so far and the potential with future DLC is amazing.I recommend this game for my part if you like or think you would like hunting game. Be responsible, make sure your computer fits the bill and be patient or wait a little longer until the game mature more before getting the game if you are unable to stands the smaller amount of issues.

content:
Posted: February 17
												Looking at others reviews, and the mix crowd, I will definitely agree that this game could use some 'fine-touches'. The one-time-purchase of this game's price tag of $29.99 might be steep for those who are unsure if they want it. My advice is don't, unless you know what you will enjoy about it. Try the original, The Hunter (think its called The Hunter Classic now if I'm not mistaken). If you like what's in there, the free part of it that is, you may like what's in here. Do note that this game will have in-game currency to allow you to buy and upgrade, much like EA's other title: The Hunter Primal, a title you may or may not have tried, but if you do then I advice just getting this game since it is looking far more promising. I have played both, and enjoyed them. With friends its more fun. So should you get this game? Ask yourself, do you like hunting? Do you like trekking? Do you like the outdoors? Do you just want to shoot something? Do you like steak and the smell of cooked meat over the fire? That last question doesn't have context to the game, but if you said yes to all those questions then, yes, you may enjoy this game and should get it!Now my experience with it so far:Barely playing up to the hour, this game is a step-up and a new future into the genre of hunting game. The sound effects are well done, to my taste. The visual is good. I don't have a heavy duty gaming PC, so I won't be playing on Ultra settings, however, the game is still enjoyable to play (perhaps much better than The Hunter Classic) minus the faulty shader/shadow bugs on my character's hand... but that stopped bothering me 5 minutes into the game. I have yet to play a little more, but I like it so far! Forgetting all the possible things you can enable and disable to allow your "challenge" of the game, this game so far, have live up to my expectations. I have not dwell into the game far enough to know if there are "too many animals". At the start of the game along with the tutorial I only manage to spot a red fox, a roe, and some bunnies! I'm eager to try this out more when I have my friends along.This is a long awaited game that's worth the wait, especially when you have some friends rearing to go. Let the trigger-happy-go-gunners commence!

content:
Posted: February 22
												Exeptional hunting game, there is none out there at the moment like this one.The goods: NO MICROTRANSACTIONS, thank god, thank you!!Graphics are beyond beautiful. 10/10 - Rain effects are the best i'v seen in an open world game. Sound design is also fantastic 10/10Animals are good and far better from most hunting games, but they have some flaws. (Get stuck, don't react to the player)Open worldQuest/mission system is really good and the whole game got this fantastic vibe. I know people want vehicles, but finally a game were we don't drive and dive the animals. Endless stunning forests and open fields you can watch while walking around.Night gameplay is really intense. Cons:Prices of gear you can buy in this game is insane. The American hunting ground seems very broken. There are animals all over the place, i came upon 5 moose, 3 bears and 5 + Deers at the same area. ruined it for me so i switched over to european hunting grounds. Animals have no ragdoll animation To get some of the "Scents" you need to reach level 39. what?GIVE ME THIS GAME IN VR!If you like hunting. This is your game. 9/10

content:
Posted: February 16
												I've played a 3 hour long sitting now and didn't experience any bugs whatsoever. Maybe i'm just lucky but i think all the bad reviews complaining about bugs are the vocal minority.I've played classic on and of since back in 2009 and enjoyed it, except for the subscription / pay-for-everything model and the insanely short draw distance of animals. Both are fixed in this release with an added layer of story missions and leveling progression. Personally i think it's great and adds another level of reward besides the joy of taking down a big buck, but the gamification of the most realistic hunting game on the market might not be for everyone.This is now my go-to version of theHunter whenever i feel the urge to hunt.

Product received for free
												A game that rewards patience, skill and a certain about of inititive.Initially beginning, for myself, a little bit quiet, one rather quickly learned that in order to get anything from the game, he would have to adapt his amateurish attempts at rushing through a forest and hoping to stumble upon an animal.Once you temper your desires thus, the game enters a period whereby you are thouroughly rewarded, and the thrill of chasing an animal through the undergrowth, utilising a mixture of your own inititive and common sense as you negotiate your way through the undergrowth and scenery in a careful manner, lest you disturb the animal and prolong the chase. When finally you take the shot and the reward is yours, it is most certainly a rewarding endeavour.Many different hunting weapons and styles are available, by utilising either a handgun, rifle, shotgun or even a bow - each comes with different ammunition available, allowing for a high degree of customisation.TL;DR,Fun game, rewarding, apply common sense.Recommended highly!

												Pros:1) Beautiful game, best immersion and wild life environment I have ever seen.  Scenery and animals are gorgeous looking.2) Realistic AI.  Animals are incredibly realistic so they are very hard to hunt.  You get a great sense of excitement even killing a small trivial deer.3) Requires a lot of patience, not a game for the rushed arcade players4) Huge map with lots of replayabilityCons:1)  Buggy.  Big game breaking such as game crashes, unable to see the tracks, animals stuck on rocks to small bugs like unable to take picture with camera, etc.2)  High learning curve.  3)  Patience, patience, patience, if you expect to shoot animals within half hours or less, this game is not for you.4)  Lack of variation in animals.  Fur color should at least be a bit different.  5)  Can be a hog on some computers.  Hunting at night sometimes can put a dip into FPS.

content:
Posted: February 21
												I'll start this off by saying that if you want a full, complete, bugless game, this is not for you. However...I have to say this is the best hunting game I have ever palyed. It's beautiful, it has co-op and although the ui is a bit buggy, all the most important parts work near flawlessly. Likewise, the last few days have proven to me that the devs care at least a little about fixing these bugs and glitches, especially on multiplayer. However this game still has a lot of bugs and glitches, nothing game-breaking so far but still annoying. Thankfully most can be solved by quickly quitting and launching the game again.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
												This isn't an easy review. As the game still has several bugs and a terrible UI. But the UI is manageable if you are somewhat presistent. It takes a bit of fiddling in order to figure it out. My main annoyance was the fact that I couldn't figure out how to replenish my ammo. Highly annoying in a game where bullets play a key role. Yet in the end I managed.The rest of the game is great. While the scenery is great and the animals behaviour feels realistic, I like the fact that you're not being help by the hand. All hints and tips can be disabled and the game leaves you alone to hunt. That is exactly what I needed on a grey saturday afternoon. Just let me walk and stalk a whitetail deer for 15 minutes, and focus on taking a kill shot. In the same line, the game gives feedback on your shot and hunting skills but again without smashing it in your face. After collecting the kill, you get a type of score board with all the information. Perfectly ignorable, not advisable if you want to become good and are sick of following a blood trail.All in all, I've decided that I like this game. The required focus and yet the casual manner that you're allowed to play in make this a game for casual players and people that really want to master it. I would recommend this game as one of the better hunting games currently out there. But we'll have to be honest and agree that the competition isn't that steep. Adjust your expectations to average and you'll have an enjoyable experience.

content:
Posted: February 20
												This game has a decent base to progress from, but in its current state is lacking a little. It feels like an early access game with all the bugs and i feel like it could greatly benefit from adding some sort of fishing element. Perhaps even the ability to cut your own tree's as another resource type, or to build a temporary lookout/hut/boat. You NEED to be able to unlock things whilst in multiplayer because your endless walking and hunting feels unrewarded. Or at the very least be able to teleport where your friends have unlocked so you dont have to run forever to find your friends. The levelling/progression system feels a bit harsh, i don't think it should be easy to unlock new items however the current way of levelling feels a little too steep. Graphically it looks really nice and the sounds are for the most part great, apart from ridiculously loud critter movements. This game should have been about half the price it currently is, or held back for half a year or so to iron out the bugs and lack of content / in-game systems. Pros: GraphicsHunting is fun despite lack of animals Huge mapMultiplayer, although bugged, could be amazing. Has great potentialCons: Bugs, Menu systems and lack of in-game content/things to do other than shooting.. (e.g give us the ability to build things after cutting wood etc) Multiplayer is too strict in terms of spawning location and not letting you unlock outposts or points of interest. Feels unfinished Not enough animals Leveling system is too slow

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27
												TLDR; The price tag of $29.99 is steep for the current state of the game and it feels like we are in an early access game that is ridden with bugs. With that being said, it is a beautiful game and I really enjoy it but the bugs do take away a lot of fun. I would wait for an update to buy it. I can not currently recommend it unless serious changes are made to the game.-----Full Review-----I am pretty frustrated because this game has so much potential. This is a gorgeous game and the concept is simply amazing. The devs really should be hiding their faces in embarassment at the moment. It truly feels like a very long time was put into the creation of the game and then they ran out of money and released it as an unfinished product. I encountered my first bug within seconds of playing the game, where the screen was unbareably blurry for the first 7 or 8 minutes of gameplay.A primary issue - The pathing of WildlifeThe pathing is completely ridiculous. Often times when you fire at a game species they freeze in place after you hit them. I am not referring to a shocked hault, I am referring to a glitchy sudden abrupt freeze of the animation. They stay there for 3-5 seconds until you shoot them again and might take a step or two. I also noticed that after you shoot an animal, they run in a 10 x 20 area in the woods in circles, and you can walk straight up to them and keep shooting at the ground and they will just keep running in circles. This is very frustrating.A second issue - The death of the WildlifeWhy do animals die standing up? They are frozen in place and sometimes hovering off the ground. There is absolutely no transition between a stationary deer and death at times, this is especially frustrating.A third issue - The hit registryI was able to walk up on a 12 point buck and get legitimately right next to it (due to the glitches and terrible pathing of the current state of the game) and I scoped in on my rifle and took a headshot at the buck (because there is an achievement to kill a certain amount of wildlife with headshots). This was an extremely easy shot because the animal was stationary. I put two headshots at point blank range in the deer and then he randomly galloped off and I had to go on an 8 minute chase where he proceeded to take two more body shots and finally collapsed (in a terribly awkward and buggy position).----- Final Thoughts -----Why was this game that has so much potential to be amazing released with so many bugs that simply make this game unplayable. I can not even complete some of the missions such as taking a photo (with the in game camera) of the Fallow Deer, because of bugs. This game is no where near ready to be played by the public. It should be labeled as early access or an open beta and the price tag should be dropped to around 10-12 USD for the current state of the game. I would love to recommend this game to my friends but I simply can not with the current state of the game.Developers ----- Fix these game breaking issues and save your game before it is too late. You should already be ashamed that you released such an unfinished product.

content:
Posted: February 27
												I'd like to say I love the idea of the game. However, I do not recommend it because it just isn't playable.After 40 minutes (!!!) of moving around I finally got my first kill. I understand that a hunter needs patience, but this is just ridiculous. There should be many more animal spawns and they shouldn't be able to detect you so easily.. They run off and it's impossible to catch up to them. There's too much grass/brush/trees in the maps that scare them off when you walk. Either minimize the sound you make when walking through them or stop filling the maps with them... I hate the fact you have to walk 24/7 whilst playing the game because if you run they will run immediately. Sooooo boring.I also hit a deer in the head and it still started running away? Wtf? I had to chase it for 5 minutes before I found it dead on the ground. In my opinion a headshot should be an instant kill, at least on a small deer.I honestly think the game is broken (and therefor, boring) right now. Takes way too long to find an animal to track and once you do, there's a large chance of it just running away as fast as you get near it. Please fix this because I'd love to start playing this game 24/7.
