content:
Posted: February 20
												While it has it's issues, like animals getting stuck (ATM) it is still very fun and rewarding. I myself only had 2 animals get stuck ever. But when it doesn't bug out it is fairly real, animals move well and act realistic. If it gets shot in the leg it will be slow and limp, if you hit its head (and miss brain) it will hold it's head down. If it's bleeding out it lays down. The only thing that is slightly strange sometimes if you don't move does will walk up to you. But hey honesly where I live they do that, haha. I think it will be fixed, the good thing is though animals don't all run when you breathe like in many sims it takes a little bit to spook them if they don't bug out. Tracking and bagging feels more fun and real to me than classic. It may have bugs, but honestly it is still fun and very good looking ( if you don't have a potato) Remember, this is a pretty much updated thehunter with wayyy more veiw distance and way better foliage. Don't forget this, if you don't havea decent pc stick to the old one. It will be patched for the amd users though they said I think. If you like hunting or just pretty areas this is for you, the graphics all in all are very pretty and the sound is great. I feel like I am in my woods when I see those sun sets and rises. I think if we keep giving the devs input and they work with us, this will be the best hunting sim I have tried, this is up there by far as one of the best even with the bugs. I have disliked some stuff they did before, but this is very good and can be the best if we keep working with them.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 22
												Well here goes for my first ever review.... 22nd of the 3rdHonestly as soon as i began to play this game i felt it hands down needs a good thumbs up added to the reviews section!TheHunter Call Of The Wild is such a supurb game, although i dont have stacks of hours yet since i have not long had the game, it gets me hooked for hours on end!what i really love is how incredibly amazing the world looks, from the different times of the day, sun position with god rays beaming through tree lines, golden hour at the end of the day as you slowly make your way across an open cornfield to the dense forests with heavy downpour... It all looks so incredble and then as you are making you way through the land you have all the ambient sounds that sound so crisp and real, i found myself many times just walking, taking in the scenery and listening to all the ambient sounds, the wind gusts, birds chirping in the trees, the crunch as you trudge through the different types of ground. i get so lost in the atmosphere and kind of just zone out on what im actually meant to be doing...... and then you hear a warning call and some footsteps from one of the many animals in the game and you instantly get your game face on, trying to move slowly and silently towards the direction of the sounds you are hearing while trying not to spook the animal into running away. Binoculars out trying to get a tag and some information about what you are about to shoot, you crouch down and get your rifle out, line up your shoot through your scope waiting for the animal to turn broadside for that perfect shot on the lungs/heart and you squeeze the trigger to hear one of the best gunshot sounds you will ever hear in a game, honestly! the crack roars across the landscape echoing into the distance while you watch to see if you dropped the animal on the spot or if it still has some fight left in it and begins running off and then you start to track it to its final resting place to claim your trophy.I honestly have hardly come across any flaws in this game except for when an animal is trying to run they will sometimes get stuck in between two tree's running on the spot, while it gives you an easy trophy you somewhat have to feel bad for taking such a cheap shot. other then that this is an amazing game and definitely worth investing the money into the game, it will satisfy you greatly.It can be a bit slow at times but that is all apart of it, dont expect to be just running flat out everywhere shooting everything you see. Because the animals as you know it have much better hearing and sight then you and will forever run away from you and you will leave empty handed every time, patience is the number 1 key in this game and when you finally get that kill it is so worth it and satisfying.There is a great range of weapons and items to choose, from rifles, handguns, compound bows, shotguns and then you have your different types of ammunition to many types of animal callers and scent sprays to lure animals to you when sitting up in a tower or ground hide. You also have standard binoculars which you can upgrade to a range finder and then a set of binos with a range finder built into them.There is plenty of content to work towards and unlock so you are insure many hours of gameplay, plus all the skill and perk tree's to unlock and help you track animals that bit easier.Definitely recommend this game 10/10Ignore the bad reviews saying it is a buggy game and it runs really bad because it seriously doesn't at the time of writing this review

content:
Posted: March 23
												Breathtaking visuals, and helpful poop piles - Hunter COTW offers the ability to experience hunting without the dirt and rain and cold wind actually getting you dirty, wet, and cold for real. Walk through the wonderful forests looking for the tell-tale signs of an animal, follow it's tracks, get intimate knowledge from it's poop and after stalking for hours finally have the beast in your sights. Inhale. Hold your breath. Fire.  If you are performing well the beast dies then and there, if not expect a mad dash through the forest to catch up and kill it. It's as close as you can get to a genuine, FUN, realistic hunting experience without leaving the comfort of your chair.But note that This is NOT a game for the impatient, for people who need to run and jump, for people who get bored easily, nor is it a game for the 'angry reddit neckbeards' who find fault in everything and demand the game is changed for them. This is a game that needs a lot of patience, and a calm manner - just like real hunting.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24
												This game is amazing. This might sound really off topic, but I'm a huge Skyrim Modder and I always loved adding hunting aspects to that game. I know the games are completely different, but one of the things I love in games is being able to explore and get lost in the world. This game really does an amazing job of letting you just get lost and lose track of time. The graphics are insane and when I got caught up in a thunderstorm late at night I actually jumped in my seat it was so immersive. The hunting is also amazing of course. I love being stealthy and I feel a high sense of achievement when I claim my trophies, track down animals and react to animal calls. I've been using Rifles and Bows the most. I look forward to sinking hundreds of hours in this game and for only 29.99, the game offers you enough content. It exceeded my expectations so far. Haven't personally noticed any bugs. But I also haven't been looking for them.

												This game is addictive!I havent played any hunting games since back when the cabelas hunting games were half decent ie. outdoor adventures 2006. This game even with all its current flaws is F*%$ing Awesome! Stalking down an animal and finally getting that kill after a bloody long period of time feels so rewarding! There are many bad reviews on here but alot of them are from people who have invested themselves deeply in the previous game and where expecting EVERYTHING to be absolutely perfect or as it was in the previous game, typical spoilt humans lol. Ive played for 20 or so hours and enjoyed every second of it!If you are looking for a huning game that is well made with a few glitches here and there, looks absolutely amazing and has the potential to be the best hunting game to date with future dlc and updates i suggest you buy this game right now!10/10 will be spending many more hours tracking down animals and pumping them full of lead!

Posted: March 29
												I really enjoy this game, it has an awesome tracking system, I like that there are missions and objectives, trinkets to collect, a MASSIVE (maybe to big) map and lots of different animals. There are plenty of flaws though. For instance everytime I've shot a bear, it charges, gets in my face, and turns around. It repeats this cycle until I finally shoot it enough with my wee little .223 for it to die. It'd be cool if there were some sort of Trophy Room like I used to see in the Deer Hunter games, or better yet, a cabin you could customize? Hint* Hint* Nudge* Nudge* development team I'm talking to you. Anyways, there is lots of walking involved and fast traveling from what I can tell is only available to be used to Warden outposts. I've only put a couple hours in and will probalby edit this if anything new is found out. All that said. I REALLY LIKE THIS GAME.

content:
Posted: February 17
												Great sim, true to the original in most respects.   A few minor bugs, but nothing that ruined my 4-hour long hunt (at least not until the very end, but more on that later).   Nice graphics, an environment that pulls you in and a nice change of pace from fast-paced shooters.   Was in a tower and shot downwards at a really nice buck, missed his vitals and spent the next couple of hours stalking him.  Finally got him well after dark, what a task.   It reminded me of the original game in that you really felt like you'd been on a hunt and had created a memory that you want to share with others that play the game.I only experienced these bugs, and most didn't create any issues in playing/enjoying the game, as I know they will be fixed soon:- My gun makes no noise when fired, you see the smoke and the recoil and it hits the animal, but no sound- My animal calls/lures only make sound once every 5 or 6 times they are used- There was a thin line on my GPS in the map and when I approached it there was an invisible wall I couldn't pass.  At first I thought maybe I had hit the edge of the map, but it was close to the start.  Had to walk along the invisible wall for about 20 feet before it let me pass, then I went back to see if it was still there and it had cleared- The only bad bug (that would affect gameplay in a major way) is when I hit around midnight in-game all of the animals froze.   I was trying to call in a buck that I'd heard and I saw his harem first (the does) and they wouldn't move.  The buck kept calling and I waited several minutes before I figured out that they were stuck.  I approached them all and they could look around, but not move in any direction.  Luckily, this was at the end of my 4-hour initial session.Despite the early flaws, this game is fantastic.   I had been waiting a long time for a new version of this game and it was worth the wait...

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18
												UPDATE AS OF 2/26/17... the latest patch fixed my crashing/game breaking bug for about a full day of playing.  Same as before with the bug beginning very irregularly, but progressing to the point where I am unable to play 5 minutes of this game before freezing up my PC and having to shut everything down.  Would really like to play devs.UPDATE AS OF 2/28/17...10 days after launch and still cannot play.  Good news is they pinged me with a live stream announcment so I can watch the game i cannot play, that I payed money for, that i cannot run past 60 seconds after loading in.  Great.Ok guys Im going for the honest no salt review here.  I will also start with the bad because Im hoping it all gets fixed.  Its not a totally negative review so keep reading.THE BAD - I cant play.  At about ~24 hours in I had found some bugs, most it did not take too much effort to find work arounds but at that 24 hour mark it tanked.  30 minutes into a play session I had my first major crash... game froze, audio loop playing the same half second of audio over and over, and I couldnt even exit to the desktop or use task manager to shut it down.  Had to turn off the PC completely and fire it back up.  The next playthrough the same thing happened in about 5 minutes... rinse and repeat this until I could get ZERO time in before locking up.  I uninstalled/reinstalled and this got me through about 3 hours of gameplay and then all the previous stuff I mentioned happened all over again.  Like I said, I cannot play.  I have a nice set up and really the only thing different from my rig than most others is the SLI.  Im at a loss on this one and its frustrating.THE GOOD - This game is a plesant mix of sim and arcade.  There are enough moments of "nothing" to make it seem like a sim, but theres also enough going on to keep it from getting boring.... to all the hardcore sim guys out there, hunting for a week in real life not killing anything is still entertaining, doing it in a game is lame and no one would play that.  The graphics are not ground breaking but the lighting, effects, and scale of things make it seem more polished than it probably is (its pleasant walking through the forrest).  As far as the hunter classic went I thought that was a garbage game, I thought it looked like trash, played about the same, and the pay model was a complete rip off.  This game on the other hand is worth the asking price as long as they fix what is above.  Not that it has much competition but it quickly became my favorite hunting game.THE MEH - The sound, no surround option, why WHY!?  Random light glitchyness and mildly annoying bugs.  The menus, specifically the loadout/store menu is really unpolished.  It also wont save my settings.  THE I WISH - I wish there was a visual difference in the animal racks, not just small and big along with an arbitrary "trophy score" once you harvest the animal.  I wish there was 4wheelers.  I wish small game hunting mattered (cannot harvest upon killing/no XP).  I wish guns were more true to life with their penetration instead of the arcady "weapon balance" to make different calibers arbitrarily matter.  I wish there was a hardcore mode so the sim guys could get their fix along with much more of a challenge.  I wish there was waterfowl hunting... and upland birds... and hunting dogs, please give us some quail and grouse.

content:
Posted: March 9
												It feels like an early beta. You have to edit config files with a text-editor to have your audio/video settings saved.Basically it feels just like the old theHunter classic they released a few years ago for free. The graphics are fancier, though I would expect more performance and better optics these days. Take witcher for example. High performance combined with pixelperfect graphics. Even animals seems more realistic.To adress only some bugs: misbehaving animals (sometimes large groups that seem to collide with each other and trees), missing inventory from time to time, invisible/unusable tools, no ammo even though you had some, missing or unrealistic soundeffects, heavy weather effects, random crashes, random weapon unequiping, sometimes traces to follow, sometimes no highlighting of traces, multiplayer laggy, missing basic UI elements (e.g. you cant go back to main menu, there is no option for it - even in multiplayer you have to quit the whole game and start it again), rifle scope becomes unusable after using bow zoom, ...I would recommend you to not buy this game until the developers fix some bugs.But I have to recall a little and admit that it still is fun. It's hard to oversee these bugs but it's possible.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27
												Read any other negative review to see why I'm not recommending. Plus there's a reason it's tagged walking simulator. You might argue that a hunting game is a walking sim because you pick a direction and walk in it and hunt any animals you can find. Except you're given tasks, and if you want to get to the location of the task you have to walk there. Bam, hello 10+ mins of running. And you can't fast travel to any hunting structures you've built, which only adds to the annoyng walking. E.g., when you start the game you spawn at a lodge you've 'claimed', then you can fast travel to any other lodge you've claimed, but then you still have to walk alllll the way to wherever your task is.

number of helpful: 3 of 12 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 24
												This game worth the 30 eur as a walking simulator only. Seriously... just take a look at my screenshot library: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198144640735/screenshots/There is a significant ammount of bugs yes, but the devs are working on it to slowly but surely make the game much,much better. If you can't stand bugs at any level, you can skip this for now. Wait another 2-3 months, and then buy it. But if you can accept some little annoying bugs, and love nature/sight and hunting, i recommend you to buy this!I'm playing pc games for like 15 (or so) years now, but this is the most beutiful and realistic open world map i ever saw. Seriously! You can see for yourself, that the devs are worked their asses off with the design, and the whole map(s). That is already worth the 30 eur in my opinion. Sometimes i realise that i played for 1 hour and doesn't even shoot one bullet... but that 1 hour not passed away with boring walking. Rather walked with excitement and open mouth, and shoot some nice pics :) And i played for 50+ hours just on Hirschfelden (one of the 2 maps). Of course the hunting aspect of the game is good too. Rifles(all guns) have realistic recoil, and aiming. There is no penalty (so far at least) in the game. So you can shoot at anything you want. There are plenty of animals to shoot, and enough present on the map when you are actually in the game. So you don't have to worry about getting a "walking simulator".If you are not interested in beutiful sights :) But belive me, this game is absolutely worth a try!

												My specs: 16 Gigs RAM/Aero GTX 1070/ Intel i7-7700kUpdate: So the game after playing over 100 hours still has bugs. But they have been putting out patches frequently to fix the bugs but sometimes fixing the bugs makes other bugs so it has been frustrating at times having things happen that break the immersion of hunting. I still am going to be positive about the future of this game and still say I like it. I mean walking around in 4k is just wonderful as I am all for open worlds.Consumers: But if you want a working game you may want to wait a month or two to see how this game develops and see if the devs can fix the major issues with the game.Old review:Bought the game today. Played 4 hours and the game ran well. The only issues I had as of today was some texture issues which I would think will be fixed eventually. Overall, my experience was fine though. Playing with friends will be a whole lot more fun than playing alone. I am not really a hunting fanatic. I just like playing hunting games for simple fun. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 10
												First off this game does seem similiar to what you would expect in an early access... regardless I still recommend this game. I'm going to start with the cons then transition to the pros I find in this game.Cons:a) Many bugs. The scope will sometimes bug out and it wont actually scope in and there is NO fix other than restarting (this applies to most bug's solutions). The terrain can be buggy in certain parts of the reservatins, mainly in the mountains because you can prone and see under the map. There are more smaller ones but those are the ones I encounter frequently.b) Multiplayer is near useless. If you want to get the full experience of the game I think the multiplayer actually TAKES from the experience. Only the host can interact with things on the reservation. The game has no tracker for who has the highest trophy score at the moment. The only semi-fun thing you can do with your friends is the multiplayer challenges. c) I'm not 100% sure about this but I'm pretty sure the game is poorly optimized. There are areas in the reservations which fps drops to hell, these points wont even make sense why it's dropping (I've gotten fps drop looking at the face of the rock). If you encounter a herd of deer and they all begin to trot or run at the same time the game can completely♥♥♥♥♥♥itself, I've had some friend's games crash because of this.Pros:a) The game is beautiful, I don't think I need to elaborate.b) Guns feel great, it definitely has a pretty good selection to choose from. The integrity mechanic regarding the guns is a good way to incite diversity in your hunting. The grind that it takes to get better weapons is also fun imo, some people may shy away from grinding but it's nice to not run through a game in < 20 hours.c) Every patch makes this game almost 2x better. Their polishing the gameplay and fixing bugs each patch and I'm assuming they'll move on to more 'fun' additions to the game. The developers are listening to the community which is nice, the changes are coming and that's all I really need to know for the future of this game's development.Verdict: Basically early access but worth the price. Not for the impatient players.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 8
												As an avid Thehunter classic player way back from 2010 -2011, (600 hours)   I was very excited to recieve an email stating that a NEW hunter game is coming out, sadly i didnt get into the beta BUT i was able to get the game after release, Below is just a quick list of Pros/Cons and a few reccomendations.First we start with the pros as of 3/8/2017- Graphics are pretty, im only on high/medium and get stable 50-60 fps- Load times are pretty quick.- The animal sounds and gun sounds are amazing, i cant tell you how i love the sound of the handguns.- Wind direction told to you for free on the compass instead of using a wind spray like in hunter classic.- Now with the new movement and sound system, Stalking is a breeze that has a good flexibility in gameplay.- Calls sound great.And now the cons,- THE RAIN!- The loudness of the rain and wind is deafening on a headset.- The music is cool at the start but quickly becomes annoying in stalking and is ridiculously loud even on the lowest settings.- There is a bug causing crashes thats been plauging me, not sure of the cause. In fullscreen i would have to restart my computer because there was no way to close nothing would respond, but im windowed i can force close it.- Animals running in circles when you call them in.- The perks and skills need a little love, the later tiers are really underpowered.- The ammo is super high priced, unless your an amazing shot you dont make alot of money using the better guns.- The guns are hard to unlock and take alot of grinding. I have 46 hours played in less than a week.- Bison are uncallable.- The missions are really hard sometimes and rely on pure luck.- Missions using the "take a picture of (x)" missions are buggy and annoying to get the right picture that it will accept.- 65% of things in the store are still too expensive.Now this is not an indepth review, just a quick throw out for anyone browsing the reviews thinking to buy. Things im noticing at this exact moment.At this exact moment i will give this game a 7/10, Would love to see more guns added a better variation of game and more variety of furs and patterns on the animals.

content:
Posted: March 10
												Do I recommend this game? I'll say "Probably, but not yet."theHunter: COTW does many things very well. It's much more polished in many respects than I was anticipating. The gameplay is relaxing and fun, so long as you have reasonable expectations going in. But as of this writing, there are several very serious bugs (and even more less-serious ones) which make it hard to fully enjoy. The dev team seems fairly active and responsive to feedback, and they've fixed several bugs. But there are a lot left, and that makes it hard to recommend. If this game looks interesting to you, put it on your wishlist and come back in a month or two. If they've fixed the major bugs at that point (and haven't released a thousand nickel-and-dime DLCs), then it will be well worth the purchase.

content:
Posted: March 10
												After 50 hours of gameplay I can make a review not based on emotion. TLDR: If you like hunting games, or want a different experience from the action games / FPS, buy it! Graphics:The game is beautiful. Landscapes are gorgeous. Lighting is awesome. Wind is awesome, leaves flying with the direction and strenght of the wind...animals are beautiful too...Everything about graphics are great in this game. I've been playing video games for 30 years and this is the first time I really enjoy not doing anything but looking around. My PC is not high end (i5 4460, 8GB, GTX 970) and I can play with good FPS on high, average on ultra. Gameplay:The game is hard. At least until you understand what is a hunting game, you'll probably get frustated. You will have hard time finding anything to shoot. And if you find, you'll ending doing a poor shot, because of the physics (they re very good). And the game is slow. Not the movements and stuff, but hunting is a slow down experience...You cant go running all around. So if you want a different experience from high speed FPS like Overwatch, CoD, BF, etc, this is a good game for you. I'm really enjoying it. A lot. I see me playing this for like 1000 hours at least (if the game receive updates for more content). With the actual content, I guess I'll have like 100-200 hours of fun, because is kinda hard to get exp and money.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 10
												Not quite a hunting simulation, but very fun. Aesthetically, the game is gorgeous. The dense vegetation, sun rays, shadows and textures make for a very immersive experience. The sound is done very well, although I wish there was a slider for certain sound effects like rain, which can get quite loud. Gameplay-wise, the game is good, but not fantastic yet. The ui and certain features and menus seem quite rushed. The animal and their behavior is overall pretty solid, but I am disappointed there isn't a deep truRACs feature like the original thehunter where trophies were unique and all the animals were different. With this system, you simply have a "trophy score" added to get your final overall score after a harvest.The game is more arcadey than the previous thehunter (called classic now) There are many more animals, the score system is not as refined and deep, but it makes for a good game you can pick up and play for about 30 minutes and still have a successful hunt.The game does suffer from several technical bugs and crashes and should have been released as an early access game, but once the kinks are ironed out I think this game can be great. So far the early patches have been excellent in this regard. I recommend this to anyone who is a fan of hunting, but also to anyone who simply wants to be immersed and experience the thrill of hunting and tracking.  I recommend having a very solid gaming PC, however, because in my opinion the biggest draw to this game is being immersed in the large maps and vegetation, so if you don't have a great PC and would have to run it on low settings I couldn't recommend it.

												This game is a lot of fun.  The graphics are amazing.  That being said there are a lot of issues that need to be ironed out.  So far the developers are providing patches on a regular basis but they tend to break things that were working.  The UI needs a lot of work, the animal AI (and graphic quality) need a ton of work (wrong sounds from animals, etc), the menus are not intuitive, etc.  However, i still recommend the game with the assumption that the developers will listen to their customers and make the necessary adjustments.If you aren't very tolerant of released game bugs then perhaps you should wait a few months but i do highly recommend the game.  It is fun and addictive.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 10
												TL;DRIf you are patient, enjoy wonderful scenery, leveling up really slow but like to have a goal that takes forever- then this is your game. It's wonderful to look at, but graphics are better in the gameplay-trailers- Which I find a bit misleading.Besides that, it's all about being patient and taking your time.It's not worth it's full price, but DO buy this if it's on sale.-----PLEASE NOTEI played this only on Hirchfelden Reserve and the review is based on Singleplayer The Story isn't important and it's no problem straying from your given tasks. Not only is it optional but you don't get pressured into doing anything at all. They mostly sound like friendly requests, and that's what it feels like as well.They do get more challenging the further you go. In terms of challenge, this goes for aquiring equiment, shooting challenging pictures and game.I didn't really concern myself with the quests, but they do maintain a certain aspect of interest of the game. Both visually and gameplay-wise.You do unlock lore by discovering/visiting places in the game. As since the reserves are based on real places,- the lore you discover is just as real. It's easy/interesting reading and you'll have something to do while waiting for an animal to pop up. Performance and Graphics It's just a whole-lot of wonderful scenery and beautiful landscape to take in. If you keep moving from place to place- you never really get tired of the visually striking environment. For some reason, I have experienced multiple FPS-drops on different places. I don't know why but it's barely noticeable.Animals ranging from bears and hogs to deer and rabbits- they all look fairly good looking and behave accordingly. Animal reactions to your presents and actions are quite realistic. Both you and all animals leave a trail on the ground, pushing bushes and grass aside to leave a mark of where you've/they've been. Details like these make it look and feel just so good.Besides the fantastic graphics that some would mistake for real life, it's a downer when you are at the corner of a big cornfield watching for a fox or a red deer- that the drawing distance falls off. Beyond 100m, objects like corn and rocks gradually disappear. There are windmills east of the reseve. If you watch them from far away - these do not have blades on them.My guess is that this is a camouflaged option of optimizing the game's FPS and balancing it with draw-distance. This reminds you that it's a game and kill the realism of it. Gameplay As mentioned above, there is a draw distance in the game and this is actually a problem for a achievement that tell you to hit a animal from 400m. Because at approximately 400-405 meters, the animals disappear from your screen. If you move closer to it, it reappears (about 380-390m). Beyond 350 meters, animals no longer react to gunshot sound either, and both of these factors can kill the thrill of the hunt.I've encountered a few other problems during my travels. I'm just gonna list some examples:* Track-highlighting and animal outlines gradually stop showing when transition from day to night. Reappear once transitioned to day again.* Animals get stuck in trees, rocks and other obstacles while running. Easy but boring kills do occur.* Fast traveling sometimes remove explored animal-need-spots, like drinking spots or places they sleep. Uncertain if this is intentional.* Rain does not show through riflescopes.* Sound indicator rarely correspond to the given sounds you make. Sounds that sound noisy actually isn't. When standing still on certain places- like in a bush or next to a tree but look around you, you generate alot of noise but it doesn't show on the indicator.* Loud sounds like thunder or powerful wind does not decrease/cover the sound the player make.DO NOT let this scare you! It's the small things that bother the most picky persons that hunt for both game and details. The gameplay itself if wonderful and intense.When you hunt for anything particular and stick to a spesific game, that's when it starts getting seriously fun! Find tracks, estimate where it is, move slowly so it doesn't see you, thinking of the wind direction to avoid it smelling you- and so on. Once you hear it calling out, closer and closer, your heart start pumping faster. If you are lucky, it's walking your direction and you can hear it rattle the leaves and bushes. Rain dripping on your clothes and dense vegetation that decreases your visibility in the foggy forest start to feel extremely real at this point. All you can do it sit and wait with your rifle aiming it's direction until it shows it's feet or antlers. It's noisy, but everything feels more quiet until you take your shot. Even I got scared of my own shots multiple times.I shot it just where I hoped it would, but it's running away. I start picking up the trail while reloading the rifle. Blood splatters indicate a vital hit and it's bleeding alot. just 3-5 minutes later, I find that beautiful creature and harvest it. Leveling, points, perks and map It's a REALLY slow process to level up, gaining perks and skill points. I don't know how it works, but I think it's like that you get perk points from lvl X and skill point after next one. When exploring, you can find collectables like antlers as well. These increase your XP and is a good addon to modestly increase the fun-factor of exploring.Trackhunting, discovering new places, spotting animals and hunting them is the way to earn XP. If you are bad at hunting, then you'll have a hard time leveling up.Perks increase spesific weapon-usage like the rifle and skill points increase your overall skills as a character. Skills have alot of variation, but I feel the perks lack alot more options per weapon.The map is big. Really big. It pinpoints locations and points of interest for you to discover and it's actually fun exploring it. Alone or with friends, you can place markers on the map for you to follow. Those markers will also tell you how much time it takes to walk there and the distance to it from your current position. The map is sadly not as detailed as I would prefer. The problem with this is that small details of the terrain do not show on the map, and doing a precise marking of something is hard to do.Pros:* No DLC's! Good job with that!* Not too bad arsenal of weapons, lures and scopes. I guess you could have more but I don't care.* Slow-paced.* Extremely big map and LOT's of hunting grounds* Beautiful-looking game* Fantastic sound-effects/quality* Intense moments happen alot when tracking down your game, making everything really exciting* Perks to increase e.g. tracking skills. This system feels realistic in terms of knowledge and experience you gain from hunting and harvesting.Cons:* Slow-paced. Sometimes feel like nothing ever happens (this can be a good thing!)* Stressing to find games to hunt and KoS- kills the joy of the game and makes it boring.* Leveling up is based on kills, harvesting, spotting new places and building places to hunt. It takes a LONG time to get a high level.* You are stuck with limited equipment and won't be able to aquire more unless you level up.* You can get stuck and hurt yourself on objects, rocks etc. When crouching, you can't climb as well as when you are standing- meaning hunting in close-quarters near steep ground end up like if it's a invisible maze around you.* "Applying" changes to resolution sometimes does not work for some reason.* Player-markers, track-highlightings and wildlife appearances needs work as since they glitch/get stuck/don't appear after long-time traveling or transition from day to night. The only way to fix this is by fast-traveling or restarting the game.I highly recommend this game to everyone.It's slow paced, rich on details, and have alot of joy for hunters. I dare say that it's close to the best hunting-simulators there is.

Posted: March 10
												If all the bugs were removed, this would be one of the best games I've ever played!Pros:The game has superlative realistic graphics and sound! You should see it on a 4K display! It requires some patience to play, similar to true hunting. Generally beautiful game!  Cons:Several glitches! Deer get stuck running in their places. Or sometimes go in circles. Or sometimes, they just stand still; even looking you in the eye as you shoot them in the face! And when they decide it's time to move… they charge at you like they are possessed! They tend to be invincible sometimes as well! I emptied full 6 rounds of .357 in to the cranium of a stand still dear… and it decided to ram me as soon as I was done; killing me instead! Seriously?! After several hours of game play… the tracks disappear! I can't find anymore footprints or blood spots of any kind! Even when an animal walks past me, or I shoot it and try to look for it… no more tracks what so ever! I have to restart the game to "temporarily" get the tracks back until they disappear on me after a few minutes of gameplay!I get killed if I sometimes walk through branches, or walk against a branch! A bison may run me over and some of my health is depleted… BUT WALKING IN TO A BRANCH IS LETHAL!   Sounds, though realistic… seem to be sometimes buggy as I play on… they cut out and come back, especially during the rain or wind. I never have any problems with other game sounds but this…I'm not able to play this game anymore. I hope I didn’t waste my money on it, cause at its present state… it's unplayable! But hopefully more patches will be made for it. HOPEFULLY!

content:
Posted: March 18
												Just a couple thoughts on this game. First, this is probably one of the best hunting games out right now, it feels like there's been a dry spell for these over the past few years. Understandable since it's a small fan base I'm sure. Nonetheless, this game is quite fun and enjoyable to play solo. A couple thoughts after putting in 12-15ish hours:- The game is quite slow paced, I saw a joke of "walking simulator 2017" and it's not far off. I'd love to see an ATV or the ability to fast travel to blinds/stands/lookouts.- This one time, I shot a doe in the head and it ran away. When I eventually tracked it down the shot tracker basically showed the bullet going right into the center of the skull and said "flesh, skull, jaw" So yeah...that happens- Personally, I think putting guns behind a level-up wall is BS. At least give me some other options. - Also, I have yet in my life to see a single-shot 7mm Magnum that someone actually takes hunting.- More guns plz. Seriously, there's like 9 rifles. - The stealth system could use a little more balance. For example: I want two speeds of crouch walking (toggle crouch, hold shift to move a little faster). Then walking should not producer the same amount of sound as running. You can walk quite softly through the woods IRL- The UX is strange. It took me 10 minutes to figure out that items in the store scroll left to right- Speaking of store, the text on the guns and stuff moves really fast, be nice if the space for the text was a little bigger so it didn't have to scroll. Please don't take my critisism to mean it's a bad game. It's not at all. In fact I've quite enjoyed the few hours I've put in. I hope it gets some updates and changes in the future. Definetly recommend if you're into the whole hunting genre.

content:
Posted: March 18
												So before I begin I would like to say that I really love this studio. I am a big fan of theHunter and have put a long time into playing that game. That being said, this game is currently unplayable for me. There are so many bugs and crashes that I simply cannot look past them and enjoy myself. But before I list those I would like to list what I do like so far.PROS:- beautiful world, graphics are simply stunning- audio ambiance and SFX are amazing - skill and perk trees are a cool addition - no microtransactions (which i did not mind in theHunter)- your in-game money is actually worth something in the store - cool story based missions and side missions- unknown points on the map to encourage you to explore the area- buildable blinds at some points of interest - wounded animal animations, this is something I thought was missing from the last theHunter CONS:- not a large variety of equipment - outfits says they have no effect on whether or not animals can detect you? - whats the point on spending 12k on an outfit then?- using callers seems to be pretty ineffective - although they are large, there are only 2 maps- there is much less to hunt it seems than theHunter - no dynamic bullet wound textures on the animal- very poor bullet penetration- with all its bugs and limited equipment it feels more like an early access or BETA rather than a full game- the original theHunter set the bar so high that this game pales in comparison, I would still much rather play the original even if this game had 0 bugs BUG LIST: (after a pretty short time playing)- MULTIPLE HARD CRASHES!!!- when starting game, background blur does not go away until openeing a menu- earned experience/perks/skillpoints are displayed at the top at incorect times- tracker sometimes displays nothing- animal tracks sometimes do not show up after resting or fast traveling - nav points show in multiple directions - animals run in circles- animals do not interact with other animals - spooking one type does not seem to spook other animals near them - after opening a menu, it takes multiple presses of ESC or BACKSPACE to exit the menu- storage/backpack menu are very glitched - the same item is displayed multiple times in the store - animals get stuck on rocks and trees very easily- player can get stuck in water very easily - many tracks below the surface of the groundIn summary, I really want to like this game and continue playing but as I said before, the bugs make it too frustrating. The amount of time you must dedicate to a hunt only to be foiled by tracking bugs or hard crashes is absolutely infuriating. While I will not play this for awhile, I do hope the devs fix these problems so that I can come back to a fully functioning and beautiful game to play in the future. I hope this is helpful to some who are on the fence about this game. Buy and play the original theHunter, and wait for them to complete this one.

content:
Posted: March 9
												I was a little nervous getting this game, as many reports problems with game crash, lag and freeze. Guess i am a lucky one, as i never encountered this at all. It really runs smoothly even on the highest settings. I run the game on an MSI Intel i7-4720HQ, 16GB RAM, NVIDIA GTX960. This is the most beautiful game i ever played where you walk in an astonishing surroundings. You just cant help but stop frequently to enjoy the view. The animals also looks good with nice animation. If i should put my finger on anything, the lake / ponds could maybe have a better texture.The sounds are good and with no problems to hear where they coming from. But at some random events, some of the sounds dissappear or turns in to noise. Not the best thing when using earplugs.You have the option to start in two different maps, Central European and North-west American. Both maps are huge with so many places to explore, you could easily play for houndreds of hours before you been on all the places. The animals however, seems to need more work. As it is now, there are some issues. An animal trying to run away from you, can end up being stuck if a tree or rock stands in their path. I also seen animals getting stuck in a loop, such as an animal chance direction when hitting tree A, and turns towards tree B, so it chance direction to tree A again and therefor chance direction again to tree B. In the tutorial, they tell us about hunting pressure and animals would avoid areas where you just killed. This isnt true at all. Animals doesnt seem to care about this for a second and would gladly walk in to an area and stand besides their fellow mates who just got shot. There are a dozen number of animals to hunt, and some of them is to be expected to attack you in defence. But if i stand only 6-7 meters away from a black bear or big moose and shoot but only get a flesh hit, i am still not attacked. The only time i got injured from an animal was when standing at its running-away path, and was runned over. And since animals are running away from you, not towards you, this is obviously not something you need to worry happen often.I have also come across animals who just stands there frozen. This is at night, so i guess they are sleeping. But if i shoot them without getting instant kill, they just run 2-3 steps before they stop and freeze again. It looks very weird. One thing i noticed first time i played this was how slow i walk. Its realistic, as you are hunting and wouldnt like to make noise. So crouching should be slow moving. But normal walking are just as well slow and walking up the stairs to a watch tower reminded me of walking with my grandmother. So it all ends up with me running around. Thats actually not so bad. Its extremly noisy and scares animals around you. In this way i can find out if there is any animals around me at all and if there is, where they are from their warning calls.The game have a nice earn money and skill system making you work to improve and afford better equipment.All in all, this is a game i enjoy and would keep playing. You need a little patient, just like in real life. But is nice and relaxing game to play when you have no time pressure upon you. The only downside for me is the animal behaviour and running path that needs an improvement. This is not an alpha game, so i am not shure it will ever be fixed.

												After 50 hours of gameplay I can make a review not based on emotion. TLDR: If you like hunting games, or want a different experience from the action games / FPS, buy it! Graphics:The game is beautiful. Landscapes are gorgeous. Lighting is awesome. Wind is awesome, leaves flying with the direction and strenght of the wind...animals are beautiful too...Everything about graphics are great in this game. I've been playing video games for 30 years and this is the first time I really enjoy not doing anything but looking around. My PC is not high end (i5 4460, 8GB, GTX 970) and I can play with good FPS on high, average on ultra. Gameplay:The game is hard. At least until you understand what is a hunting game, you'll probably get frustated. You will have hard time finding anything to shoot. And if you find, you'll ending doing a poor shot, because of the physics (they re very good). And the game is slow. Not the movements and stuff, but hunting is a slow down experience...You cant go running all around. So if you want a different experience from high speed FPS like Overwatch, CoD, BF, etc, this is a good game for you. I'm really enjoying it. A lot. I see me playing this for like 1000 hours at least (if the game receive updates for more content). With the actual content, I guess I'll have like 100-200 hours of fun, because is kinda hard to get exp and money.

Posted: March 10
												Do I recommend this game? I'll say "Probably, but not yet."theHunter: COTW does many things very well. It's much more polished in many respects than I was anticipating. The gameplay is relaxing and fun, so long as you have reasonable expectations going in. But as of this writing, there are several very serious bugs (and even more less-serious ones) which make it hard to fully enjoy. The dev team seems fairly active and responsive to feedback, and they've fixed several bugs. But there are a lot left, and that makes it hard to recommend. If this game looks interesting to you, put it on your wishlist and come back in a month or two. If they've fixed the major bugs at that point (and haven't released a thousand nickel-and-dime DLCs), then it will be well worth the purchase.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 10
												Not quite a hunting simulation, but very fun. Aesthetically, the game is gorgeous. The dense vegetation, sun rays, shadows and textures make for a very immersive experience. The sound is done very well, although I wish there was a slider for certain sound effects like rain, which can get quite loud. Gameplay-wise, the game is good, but not fantastic yet. The ui and certain features and menus seem quite rushed. The animal and their behavior is overall pretty solid, but I am disappointed there isn't a deep truRACs feature like the original thehunter where trophies were unique and all the animals were different. With this system, you simply have a "trophy score" added to get your final overall score after a harvest.The game is more arcadey than the previous thehunter (called classic now) There are many more animals, the score system is not as refined and deep, but it makes for a good game you can pick up and play for about 30 minutes and still have a successful hunt.The game does suffer from several technical bugs and crashes and should have been released as an early access game, but once the kinks are ironed out I think this game can be great. So far the early patches have been excellent in this regard. I recommend this to anyone who is a fan of hunting, but also to anyone who simply wants to be immersed and experience the thrill of hunting and tracking.  I recommend having a very solid gaming PC, however, because in my opinion the biggest draw to this game is being immersed in the large maps and vegetation, so if you don't have a great PC and would have to run it on low settings I couldn't recommend it.

content:
Posted: March 6



theHunter™: Call of the Wild 
A Screenshot of theHunter™: Call of the Wild
By: Gankdalf




theHunter: Call of the wild is really a bittersweet experience. The landscapes and forests are some of the best that I’ve ever seen in a game. Nothing so far comes close to the beautiful scenery in Call of the wild. It’s very relaxing & the gameplay itself is what you can expect from a hunting game. The gameplay is slow and needs a lot of patience. The ambient sounds and weather effects are all excellent & really immersive. The animals look great and the animations look good. Now the bitter part. theHunter: Call of the wild plays and feels as if it’s an early alpha. It’s riddled with bugs and quirks that really screws up the fun. The main thing that screw it up are the random crashes. There doesn’t seem to be a correlation between them and there’s no way to avoid it as far as I know. I even had my stats, inventory and cash all reset back to default after several hours of playtime. In multiplayer, there are a lot of bugs as well. Simply by clicking “multiplayer” in the game menu it will randomly kick a player from my server. It does not save progress in terms of your current location & if you disconnect while you’ve  taken part in a multiplayer competition on the server it will count as if you’re back on square 1 once you reconnect. It’s all very annoying little bugs that feel like something you could expect from an incomplete early access game. But a full release? Unacceptable. The game is amazing while it actually works though. I hope that the developers will sort these bugs out soon. If you’re looking to buy this game I suggest you head over to theHunters discussion forum & check the latest news for the game & see if they’ve recently patched it. If there’s a lot of complaints about crashes & whatnot then I suggest you wait. Once they fix these bugs I will edit my review & give it a thumbs up.Edit:


theHunter™: Call of the Wild 
A Screenshot of theHunter™: Call of the Wild
By: Gankdalf




As you can see by the developer response to this review they did sort out the worst of the bugs, namely the random crashes and they are working on fixing some QoL stuff related to the menu which is much appreciated. Multiplayer is still wonky in terms of progress not saving, joined players cant save outposts etc but at this point I feel like the game deserves to be recommended. As a single player experience it's a solid game & certainly the best hunting game that I have played.

Get it on SaleWell, it's a hunting game. Nice atmosphere, huge map. Forests are interesting, and the landmarks are quite well crafted.Honestly, the game is great as an idea, the current execution is bad though. Audio sorces are flipped (ie you see things in front of you, they make noise behinde you), there are some awkward places where you can get stucke in the world geometry as well as having a somewhat poor customization choices.Some mechanics are questionable, examples being of skills that should be passive, but are active, as well as silent hunting weapons such as a bow, spooking half the forest.Finally, there are some glaring AI issues. Simplistic animal logic aside, they sometimes completely break and sit in one place. The game is absent of a food chain. Bears and Deer, Coyotes and Elks, they are one big happy family waiting for you to slaughter them.Maybe in 10-15 updates game will be awesome, as it is now, it's a 6/10.

content:
Posted: March 18
												So before I begin I would like to say that I really love this studio. I am a big fan of theHunter and have put a long time into playing that game. That being said, this game is currently unplayable for me. There are so many bugs and crashes that I simply cannot look past them and enjoy myself. But before I list those I would like to list what I do like so far.PROS:- beautiful world, graphics are simply stunning- audio ambiance and SFX are amazing - skill and perk trees are a cool addition - no microtransactions (which i did not mind in theHunter)- your in-game money is actually worth something in the store - cool story based missions and side missions- unknown points on the map to encourage you to explore the area- buildable blinds at some points of interest - wounded animal animations, this is something I thought was missing from the last theHunter CONS:- not a large variety of equipment - outfits says they have no effect on whether or not animals can detect you? - whats the point on spending 12k on an outfit then?- using callers seems to be pretty ineffective - although they are large, there are only 2 maps- there is much less to hunt it seems than theHunter - no dynamic bullet wound textures on the animal- very poor bullet penetration- with all its bugs and limited equipment it feels more like an early access or BETA rather than a full game- the original theHunter set the bar so high that this game pales in comparison, I would still much rather play the original even if this game had 0 bugs BUG LIST: (after a pretty short time playing)- MULTIPLE HARD CRASHES!!!- when starting game, background blur does not go away until openeing a menu- earned experience/perks/skillpoints are displayed at the top at incorect times- tracker sometimes displays nothing- animal tracks sometimes do not show up after resting or fast traveling - nav points show in multiple directions - animals run in circles- animals do not interact with other animals - spooking one type does not seem to spook other animals near them - after opening a menu, it takes multiple presses of ESC or BACKSPACE to exit the menu- storage/backpack menu are very glitched - the same item is displayed multiple times in the store - animals get stuck on rocks and trees very easily- player can get stuck in water very easily - many tracks below the surface of the groundIn summary, I really want to like this game and continue playing but as I said before, the bugs make it too frustrating. The amount of time you must dedicate to a hunt only to be foiled by tracking bugs or hard crashes is absolutely infuriating. While I will not play this for awhile, I do hope the devs fix these problems so that I can come back to a fully functioning and beautiful game to play in the future. I hope this is helpful to some who are on the fence about this game. Buy and play the original theHunter, and wait for them to complete this one.

content:
Posted: March 18
												Just a couple thoughts on this game. First, this is probably one of the best hunting games out right now, it feels like there's been a dry spell for these over the past few years. Understandable since it's a small fan base I'm sure. Nonetheless, this game is quite fun and enjoyable to play solo. A couple thoughts after putting in 12-15ish hours:- The game is quite slow paced, I saw a joke of "walking simulator 2017" and it's not far off. I'd love to see an ATV or the ability to fast travel to blinds/stands/lookouts.- This one time, I shot a doe in the head and it ran away. When I eventually tracked it down the shot tracker basically showed the bullet going right into the center of the skull and said "flesh, skull, jaw" So yeah...that happens- Personally, I think putting guns behind a level-up wall is BS. At least give me some other options. - Also, I have yet in my life to see a single-shot 7mm Magnum that someone actually takes hunting.- More guns plz. Seriously, there's like 9 rifles. - The stealth system could use a little more balance. For example: I want two speeds of crouch walking (toggle crouch, hold shift to move a little faster). Then walking should not producer the same amount of sound as running. You can walk quite softly through the woods IRL- The UX is strange. It took me 10 minutes to figure out that items in the store scroll left to right- Speaking of store, the text on the guns and stuff moves really fast, be nice if the space for the text was a little bigger so it didn't have to scroll. Please don't take my critisism to mean it's a bad game. It's not at all. In fact I've quite enjoyed the few hours I've put in. I hope it gets some updates and changes in the future. Definetly recommend if you're into the whole hunting genre.

												The game is an incredible openworld game.The audio is from amazing quality and I have not seen any other game with such realistic sounds.The graphics are also very amazing and from high quality. Due to my graphics card I couldn't run the game on ultra.The gameplay is very slow but fun and intreresting in the beginning.Due to the games gameplay being so slow it takes a long time to walk a great distance.Finding and then sneaking up on an animal also takes quite some time. There are hotspots where you can wait for animals but there is no fast forwarding on spot. You can however sleep till 30 minutes before the animals eat or rest and then go to one of the sleeping or feeding spots.Sneaking up on animals can also be very hard sometimes. When an animal is far away it takes some time to crawl close to it. And when you are finally there you shoot and miss and you would have to spend 15-30 minutes to find a new animal, crawl towards it and then shoot it.If there was some kind of career mode it would have been kinda more intreresting. I would say this game is worth €15 for the gameplay. With a career mode or something in that direction it would be more fun. Maybe give some more hints. Make difficulty modes like (easy, medium, hard, realistic).This game is like an early release. The base is there but it misses some gameplay and its also very slow gameplay which I do not like that much.If you like shooting an animal once every 15-30 minutes waiting and crawling go ahead and buy the game.

content:
Posted: March 6



theHunter™: Call of the Wild 
A Screenshot of theHunter™: Call of the Wild
By: Gankdalf




theHunter: Call of the wild is really a bittersweet experience. The landscapes and forests are some of the best that I’ve ever seen in a game. Nothing so far comes close to the beautiful scenery in Call of the wild. It’s very relaxing & the gameplay itself is what you can expect from a hunting game. The gameplay is slow and needs a lot of patience. The ambient sounds and weather effects are all excellent & really immersive. The animals look great and the animations look good. Now the bitter part. theHunter: Call of the wild plays and feels as if it’s an early alpha. It’s riddled with bugs and quirks that really screws up the fun. The main thing that screw it up are the random crashes. There doesn’t seem to be a correlation between them and there’s no way to avoid it as far as I know. I even had my stats, inventory and cash all reset back to default after several hours of playtime. In multiplayer, there are a lot of bugs as well. Simply by clicking “multiplayer” in the game menu it will randomly kick a player from my server. It does not save progress in terms of your current location & if you disconnect while you’ve  taken part in a multiplayer competition on the server it will count as if you’re back on square 1 once you reconnect. It’s all very annoying little bugs that feel like something you could expect from an incomplete early access game. But a full release? Unacceptable. The game is amazing while it actually works though. I hope that the developers will sort these bugs out soon. If you’re looking to buy this game I suggest you head over to theHunters discussion forum & check the latest news for the game & see if they’ve recently patched it. If there’s a lot of complaints about crashes & whatnot then I suggest you wait. Once they fix these bugs I will edit my review & give it a thumbs up.Edit:


theHunter™: Call of the Wild 
A Screenshot of theHunter™: Call of the Wild
By: Gankdalf




As you can see by the developer response to this review they did sort out the worst of the bugs, namely the random crashes and they are working on fixing some QoL stuff related to the menu which is much appreciated. Multiplayer is still wonky in terms of progress not saving, joined players cant save outposts etc but at this point I feel like the game deserves to be recommended. As a single player experience it's a solid game & certainly the best hunting game that I have played.

content:
Posted: March 9
												Update after owning for a few weeks. despite the review I wrote below, at the time I cant recommend Call of the Wild.  This game should have been labeled in alpha/beta until they ironed out the bugs, which are TOO NUMEROUS to mention.  From animals getting stuck, or stuck in a loop, to fatal crashes, to simple things like custom sights not staying attached.  Game has a potential, but I will leave a negative recommendation until they prove they are commited to fixing the game before trying to make money off community generated advertising, paid DLC, etcHaving been interested in a previous theHunter game, but being turned away by pay to play, I decided to pick this up.  Decent price point to start with, which is good, because I wouldnt have payed 50+.  The graphics are amazing and the environment feels extremely realistic, from the trees and leaves falling in the wind, to the excellent sound design.  The terrain has a great variation of areas, and tiny details such as bats fluttering around at night make it really shine.  Even just as a walking simulator it would feel very fulfilling, but add the thrill of the hunt makes it even better .  The maps are huge there are two of them, which would probably take an hour to walk across.  Granted I have a beefy video card, but all the visual effects are super nice.  Night time is dark, but not TOO dark, giving you nice godrays from the moonlight through the fogSome bugs they need to work on though, such as animals getting stuck, rare crashes, broken multiplayer.  Other annoyances include EXTREMELY loud water, clunky menus, and other HUD issues.  Also one of the cricket sounds can be extremely loud, and sounds exactly like my smoke alarm when its low on batteriesOverall I think it was worth the $30 as a gesture of good faith, I just hope they listen to community and keep working on this, rather than moving on to making the next game. Dont expect to run and gun deer, it takes time to creep up on them ... this is a simulator, not COD hunting. Happy hunting

content:
Posted: February 18
												This game doesn't feel like its complete. It has amazing graphics and is one of the only decent hunting games in modern times. That's it for the pros, now for the cons. Prepare for an arcade adventure, because if you try to play the game as a real hunter would, then you're in for a sour taste in your mouth. A seasoned hunter knows to properly take down a deer, you aim for the chest to hit the heart and lungs for a clean kill. In this game, if its not a headshot, its not a one hit kill, and even then, it has to hit a sweet spot in the ear, other wise you're chasing said deer for three miles just for the "disapearing tracks glitch" to take effect so you can never find the body or track anything else until you restart the game. This game has more glitches than content, and I am not exaderating. There are many species of animals to hunt, but not so many ways to hunt them. You have about 7 rifles, 2 shotguns, two bows, three handguns, and there you go, a single lure for most kinds of deer or small game, and a single scent for most game. This game feels very empty, I still enjoy it, but it is far from complete and not worth full price. I'd be more than happy to give this a thumbs up if they'd fix more than a single bug and added more content, but until then, wait this one out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 3
												I've been having fun with this game for a little over two weeks. I like it a lot and would recommend it.  I'll just give you some pros and cons rather than some tl;dr in depth review.PROS:Beautiful enviroment with immersive weather and day night cyclesAccurate, and immersive sounds from the environment and surrounding animalsDecently Realistic animal behaviors and senses, including smell sight and sound awareness.Option to vary the degree of realism (offers the choice of toggling various visual assistance effects)Landmarks and Lore points throughout the map add depth and interesting information.Good weapon mechanicsFairly indepth tutorialGood choice of weaponsAwesome X-ray view breakdown of kills to show shot placement and anatomy effectedEuropean and American Pacific Hunting worlds availableMaps are EXPANSIVE. Lots of places to go.Multiplayer CapableActive Dev team making corrections oftenCons:Honestly, the only real con I can think of that isn't just a subjective opinion  would be the Bugs. There are several bugs, the most of these occur in multiplayer. Nothing gamebreaking per se, but some that can be quite irritating. (I would personally like there to be even more types of animals to hunt, ie, Rams, Caribou, Grizzlies, Turkeys, more species of deer)Quick Bug list and frequency of occurrence as of 4/2/2017: 1) Animal AI not initiating properly leading to helpless game standing still. (Occasionally in both SP And MP) (in 2 weeks of playing, iv'e seen it 4 times)2) Animal Entity State failing to update properly, leading to animals running in place after being shot, and then being non-harvestable after being killed.   (In MP, Occurs Frequently (~30% of kills)  *NEVER occurs in SP.* ---Possible Netcode issue)3) Deer Bleat call can be heard loudly by the player when being used by any other players on the map, regardless of location or distance in world. (Always/100% bug rate. MP bug only)4) Animals Struck by Player weapon leaving no tracks or blood trails whatsoever. (Rarely happens on both MP and SP) (Happened twice in 45 hrs of playtime once each on MP and SP modes)5) Certain Animal call lures will glitch when you crouch while they are triggering their animation/sound file, causing the player to be unable to use the caller again until after switching between active items. (100% with certain callers both MP and SP) --minor irritation.6) Tritium (glowdot) iron sights auto-unequiping from rifle when switching between items. (100% MP and SP)7) Scope sights removed from backpack and left in storage still equipable. (100% SP & MP)

												I do like this game but if it's yes or no, right now no. Game is not marked as controller compatible, yet in order to move quietly you NEED a controller. Walking speed, even when crouch or prone on keyboard makes max noise pretty much. No variable speed there. Also apparently this game had a beta but when you fire a scoped gun still it will phase through the scope and you can see your ironsights. I saw videos of this a while back and it still happens.I feel the 3d audio needs to be a bit better if I were to play this with the assists off. I have a Skyrim mod that is like HRTL or something audio, and it is the BEST 3d audio I have ever used on a headset. No fake surround crap, it is real audio positioning.What else? Oh, being able to know what the base zeroing is on your gun would be good. When I zero a real optic I don't zero it for stupid numbers like 1.0002. No more like 100 meters, 200 meters, yards whatever. Same for these weird♥♥♥♥♥optic zoom levels. One of the scopes is like 8.000 something. That would be 8x or 8 power if you were to read it.A lot of the tutorial message text is cut off as well on the codex page.Would be nice to know how detailed this ballistics system is. Can I shoot through leaves or small limbs on trees? I had a difficult shot ingame but it missed but I can't tell if that's because you have NO CLUE WHERE YOU ZEROED YOUR OWN GUN, or if the ballistics are really sketchy.EDIT: Walking speed has been fixed. All good now.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 7
												The game plays very smooth, it is really good looking and the user interface is well done, but this game misses on the most important part, rewarding players for proper shot placement. At this point in the game you will make a well placed shot and the animal will still run for miles a lot of the time, occasionally the animal will only run a shot distance but usually not. also there is no effect of the energy transfer from the bullet into the animal as well as no consideration for arteries. Yesterday i took a shot at a moose from a front facing left angle and a slight elevation and i passed harmlessly between the lungs barely missed the heart and hit the bottom of the right lung, then the animal proceeded to lead me on a 3 mile chase because i was frustrated and just chancing it. In real life or even most other hunting games that shot would have lead to a very quick kill and not what was treated as a  "flesh wound" essentially. Your best bet in the game right now is to go for spine shots which most hunters i know find to be an unethical and irresponsible shot that you shouldn't take. also the penetration most of the rounds in this game have are quite unrealistic lacking the penetration to even reach the heart from the side let alone the other lung.Also for a hunting game where is the 30-06 or .308 you know what are probably the two most popular hunting calibers there are in NA?this came has awesome potential but it really needs to clean up its most important aspect i think.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19
												Update:After another 4 hours or so and playing multiplayer with my brother, it is apparent how quickly the tires fall off of this game.  The connection between us randomly drops.  We had to both exit the game then come back in to get reconnected.  I had several UI related bugs reference losing my entire HUD.  Couldn't see or use any of the weapons/calls.  After about five tries, we got reconnected and were able to play for several hours.  During a long hunt, we tracked a male moose high up into the mountains.  We tracked him for at least 40 minutes.  When we found him, it was in a clearing on top of the mountain.  There was some kind of AI tracking bug, that caused the male moose, a female moose, and several deer to just run around in a circle and back and forth in this glade.  We just stood there and mowed them all down.  Not the way I envisioned such a great tracking experience going at the end.  Kind of took all the fun out of the hunt. It is apparent now that the company rushed this to market, charged a premium price and is using that money to re-invest development time into the game based on such user feedback. Pretty pathetic.  If they did have a Beta cycle, it was clearly for show.  I would recommend waiting to purchase this until the re-earn the communities' trust and put some real effort into filling this out.Original:I've got just under 5 hours of play so far.  I have had no game crashing bugs or major playability issues.  Most of the bugs I've encountered are UI related.  I bought a Bow and intended on putting it into storage, but then I could not get anything out.  I've had issues with the Store and buying things being flaky.  At any rate, I'm not sure why the development team did not get the UI and related functionality solid before moving onto more important things.  UI is User Experience.  If that is broken, playability suffers upfront.  That's really unexcusable in my mind.  The description of the game says it's based on 7 years of the Classic game's experience.  Well that must be in the hunting features and not UI creation.  Provided they fix the UI issues, I really have no major complaints.  The hunting experience has been really good so far in my play.  I've not tested the Multi-player group hunt stuff yet, but so far, I've enjoyed it, as have my kids.  I just wish they'd get the UI working properly, particularly when it comes to buying things, using the menus, etc...

content:
Posted: February 22
												So actually after the first patch the game is much better now! It's getting more realistic since the A.I. updates, also everything else looks to work smoother. I just hope that missions and Lore unlocking will work soon in Multiplayer! Also I think everyone would like to see more variety of animals, like birds for example.Still, a lot of potential in this game!Old Review:I'm a huge fan of The Hunter Classic and I was playing it from the beginning. Also I was looking forward for his one for a very long time, but they released a totally unfinished game with tons of bugs. In my opinion the worst bugs are:-The game is crashing when you open up the map ar trying to select something in the options.. Disabling Steam Cloud doesnt help(This is the recommended solution to fix crashes)-AI is totally stupid. If you shoot from the big distance, they wont even hear the shot. Sometimes if its a herd and you shoot one of the animals, other animals doesnt seem to care a bit and just keeps wandering. Also all animals always make a warning call when they hear you, so you can sprint all over the map, and get sneaky only when you hear a warning call. If you hit an animal, it will run for like 20 meters and then goes back to what he was doing, sometimes returning to the same place where you shot it. Also if you find a "Need zone", the animals keep returning there very soon even if you spook them or shoot them.-The multiplayer has no modes at all, but two modes were promised. Competetive and Cooperative. In online mode noone can take outposts, do missions or construct a tower. Only a host can do this. Also there's no competetivity since there's only a small feature to make a competition like "Who shoots a buck first..." etc., which often make your game crash and disconnect all your friends if you are the host of the server... -The storage doesnt work for all the items, for example you cant put the bullets there. So if you bought too many(like I did, since starting bullets are free), they will definitely slow you down, and you wont be able to do something unless you shoot them all in the air...-You cant construct all the equipment which you find on the map.-Animals doesnt seem to care if you switch the lamp right up their face.-Animals gets stuck in the enviroment so often that it became very common thing. Also sometimes they just stop and freezes, only moving it's head or not moving at all. It has some good features too. -The graphics are awesome! I play it on 2k and it looks amazing, the sounds are perfect except for the rabbit and squirrels since they are the loudest animals, I mean seriously, they are the loudest...-The maps are huge and gets different smoothly while you travel, the openings of lands are breathtaking.-Hunting at night is even more awesome than at daytime, the atmosphere feels perfect with all the sounds which differ from day and also the moon!...-Feed zones, rest zones etc. are awesome addition!-Rendering distance of animals is very big.-The grass is dynamic and you can see the animal trails on it, also your own and your friends if you play online. -You can make more sounds and animals wont spook when the wind gusts or rain starts, which is really realistic.It's a very promising game, but it is near to be unplayable at all at this state and it was definitely not ready for the release. I just hope it won't be an arcade hunting game, since we have lots of those and they are all crap. The Hunter Classic is still the best hunting game out there.

content:
Posted: February 17
												EDIT REVIEW:After about 13hrs gameplay and some bugfixes from EW I can now recommend the game. If you can come along with a somehow weird XP system for unlocking and buying stuff and don't give a damn about leaderboards and competitions like in the classic version, then go ahead and buy this game. It is a pure hunting game with great graphics and a promising look into future patches and updates. There are still some bugs (not gamebreaking) but it looks like that they will be fixed soon.---- end of edit ----After this short time of playing (1.8hrs) I can say that there is a big potential in the game but also a lot of bugs which bring you down to typical EW reality.IN THE CURRENT STATE I CAN NOT RECOMMEND TO BUY THIS GAME BECAUSE OF:Small bugs I experienced:- in the menu (no return with ESC, no saving of sound settings for next gameplay)- the inventory (not possible to change between store and storage, freezing menu, not possible to change items from backpack to sorage and vice versa)- the menu itself looks like from a console game and is very complicated to go through- graphic glitches (when you crouch on uneven terrain you can see the 'underworld', sometimes you can see the red color of forgotten textures on objects)- when you change in permanent moving state (key 'G') with empty hands (key 'H') from running to walking the arms still swinging in running state- sometimes when walking with empty hands the mobile phone style Huntermate comes up with no screen (only the frame)This things will bring the fun factor down rapidly and leave you behind with a shaking head.I played the classic version since the very beginning and faced all this problems there. Bugs evolved over the years and piled up till today.The same will happend here I guess. It looks like that this game has not been tested properly before release and now this small bugs will stay there for a looooong time and the customers are fooled again.But that seems to be the politics and normal state with EW.What I not get is that there is a huge community willing to help with beta testing and still EW is not able to do it right. Not even after the mess with the classic version.If you do not have to, than do not buy this game now. Wait for a couple of months and some bug fixing which will hopefully occur....
