Just remember this is a game that was just released and they are still working on it, I understand! I would recommend this game if you like slow-paced and immersive games like I do!Cheers! -Xpheire

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 26
												Soooooo, this game. It looks damn amazing. The controls are solid and the aiming, shooting, etc. are competently done. But the reviews are mixed, so what gives?The big problem this game has at the moment is issues with animals getting stuck in terrain and you getting killed if you get stick in a little ditch in the ground.There's other issues too, for example I'm missing a decent form of transporation in the extremely vast maps. Yes there's teleport to outposts you discovered before, but getting there can sometimes take a very long time.Where's my Bullet cam? I know it's not realistic, but I loved having good shots rewarded with a satisfying Sniper-esque slowmo bullet-following camera. Sadly this game doesn't have this at all, not even as an option.Unlocking the various items can take a bit of time, with some of the objectives really testing your patience.The bugs are the major negative as far as I can see. The game is gorgeous though, the two environments are well crafted and positively massive in size. The sound design is a 9/10 with some individual sounds sticking out from the mix more than they should, but overall it's a beautiful experience to roam through the forest in this game. Some of ambient bird calls aren't exactly correct for a supposedly german forest, but I'm nitpicking here. The weapon sounds are realistic and satisfying. You only get two maps though, as well as a handful of weapons. The animal variety also isn't too great. However it's only 30 Euros at the time of writing, and the devs were smart enough to provide a skill and perk system to help with long term motivation. If you're a fan of hunting games, or enjoy realistic renditions of nature in games, this is a solid game. No microtransactions, what you see is what you get. Could do with bugfixing though. The issues don't happen all the time, but they're there.Overall, considering the price and the quality of the environments, and the otherwise solid shooting mechanics, I give this one a thumbs up.

content:
Posted: February 26
												I don't really have much to say that is negative. Be prepared to walk. A lot. No, I mean a LOT. Luckily, I'm rather enjoying the strolls when the world looks as good as it does. Sound design is pretty fantastic. My only issue is that rabbits sometimes sound like they're a bear coming through the bushes to kill me. Other than that, I've yet to encounter a real bug but I have had one CTD on startup. Again, only 4 hours so far.That said, I'm iffy on whether or not to recommend this for anyone not super interested in playing a game about hunting. Sure, you don't have to sit in a blind nearly as long as you would IRL, but you will find yourself becoming impatient if moving slowly and being mindful of the wind isn't your thing. I would hope there are some additional ways to squeeze performance out of this game, but I'm lagging behind with a GTX 770 at this point, so I've got nothing really to complain about there.My only peeve is the UI. I find it somewhat cumbersome and the menus dont seem to flow fantastically. Beyond that, not having a way to quickly switch my ammo type without having to jump into the menu is slightly aggravating. All in all however, its a pretty solid game. WAY better than that F2P nonsense with more microtransactions than almost anything I've ever seen that they made previously. The lack of those micro's means this game flows much better. If you want to go hunting from the comfort of your gaming chair, or whatever it is you sit in, this is it.

After a few hours in I can say that the game is absolutely beautiful. I have had a few issues with bugs but what is there to expect? Dropped from 100% accuracy to 60% just trying to shoot one animal. Also the reg when you do hit the animal needs work too. Example; I shoot the heart area but the animal limps away and then I cannot find it.One other thing that needs tweaking is the sound that you make when you move. It's extremely sensitive and nearly impossible to hunt anything because they all have super hearing. Animals are hearing me from 300m away.I would recommend this game though, even in it's current stage. I would say that I paid the right price for it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 26
												This is my first time leaving a review on Steam. Like many others I felt compelled to write a review to help others decide if this is worth a purchase in it's current state. After a considerable amount of play time, here is what I think so far! The first thing I noticed was how amazing this game looks! From lush forests to open strawfields to rocky mountains and lakes the maps provide a nice variety of scenery. The sound effects are very good and really help to immerse you in the environments. The weather system is also very good with effects like fog and cloud coverage changing lighting. The game mechanics feel good. Plenty of variety of animals. The progression system has been changed since launch making it much more accessible but somewhat challenging. Now to the ugly! This is the buggiest bugfest of a game I have ever played! Regular crashes, broken multiplayer, buggy menu icons, buggy animals, not being able to click and unlock things in the game and the list carrys on! With all that being said for me personally this game was worth the money. The developers seem to be working hard to fix issues and overall, issues aside, this has been an enjoyable experience. This game has a lot of potential.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 26
												Soooooo, this game. It looks damn amazing. The controls are solid and the aiming, shooting, etc. are competently done. But the reviews are mixed, so what gives?The big problem this game has at the moment is issues with animals getting stuck in terrain and you getting killed if you get stick in a little ditch in the ground.There's other issues too, for example I'm missing a decent form of transporation in the extremely vast maps. Yes there's teleport to outposts you discovered before, but getting there can sometimes take a very long time.Where's my Bullet cam? I know it's not realistic, but I loved having good shots rewarded with a satisfying Sniper-esque slowmo bullet-following camera. Sadly this game doesn't have this at all, not even as an option.Unlocking the various items can take a bit of time, with some of the objectives really testing your patience.The bugs are the major negative as far as I can see. The game is gorgeous though, the two environments are well crafted and positively massive in size. The sound design is a 9/10 with some individual sounds sticking out from the mix more than they should, but overall it's a beautiful experience to roam through the forest in this game. Some of ambient bird calls aren't exactly correct for a supposedly german forest, but I'm nitpicking here. The weapon sounds are realistic and satisfying. You only get two maps though, as well as a handful of weapons. The animal variety also isn't too great. However it's only 30 Euros at the time of writing, and the devs were smart enough to provide a skill and perk system to help with long term motivation. If you're a fan of hunting games, or enjoy realistic renditions of nature in games, this is a solid game. No microtransactions, what you see is what you get. Could do with bugfixing though. The issues don't happen all the time, but they're there.Overall, considering the price and the quality of the environments, and the otherwise solid shooting mechanics, I give this one a thumbs up.

content:
Posted: February 26
												I don't really have much to say that is negative. Be prepared to walk. A lot. No, I mean a LOT. Luckily, I'm rather enjoying the strolls when the world looks as good as it does. Sound design is pretty fantastic. My only issue is that rabbits sometimes sound like they're a bear coming through the bushes to kill me. Other than that, I've yet to encounter a real bug but I have had one CTD on startup. Again, only 4 hours so far.That said, I'm iffy on whether or not to recommend this for anyone not super interested in playing a game about hunting. Sure, you don't have to sit in a blind nearly as long as you would IRL, but you will find yourself becoming impatient if moving slowly and being mindful of the wind isn't your thing. I would hope there are some additional ways to squeeze performance out of this game, but I'm lagging behind with a GTX 770 at this point, so I've got nothing really to complain about there.My only peeve is the UI. I find it somewhat cumbersome and the menus dont seem to flow fantastically. Beyond that, not having a way to quickly switch my ammo type without having to jump into the menu is slightly aggravating. All in all however, its a pretty solid game. WAY better than that F2P nonsense with more microtransactions than almost anything I've ever seen that they made previously. The lack of those micro's means this game flows much better. If you want to go hunting from the comfort of your gaming chair, or whatever it is you sit in, this is it.

												You have to respect development teams who cater so such a niche audience. It's really hard to find a decent hunting game now. The only one's that come to mind are Cabela's and the last game I (and many others) played from them magically stopped launching after about 30 hours. Call of the Wild is a flawed gem, though. It has some of the most beautiful scenery I've ever seen in a game. So beautiful that I often find myself surprised that it runs at all on my hardware (750ti, i5 7700k) With a huge map, day and night cycles and varying weather systems the game boasts a deeply immersive atmosphere that is only broken by the often buggy behavior of an animal you're hunting. I'm giving the game a positive review because I'm enjoying it, and I am confident the devs will fix the animal behavior/pathing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 21
												Got charged by a bear after I shot her babyThen I shot her and killed herthen I sold her fur in order to buy more ammothen I used that ammo to finish of her baby.Jokes aside, this game, while I've only played it for about two hours at this point and I have yet to try out multiplayer, feels great for what it promises to deliver.With (extremely) beutiful scenery and graphics this game immerses you heavily into the mindset of a hunter, and while some of the hunting aspects are a bit clunky, like a deer being able to hear you crawling in the middle of a thunderstorm 60 meters away, the problems i've experienced are relatively minor and should be fixed very soon.+No microtransactions, they have been replaced by gaining money from selling your kills; A quick and clean kill on a buck might yield you 1500 funbucks, and a new gun will cost you around 20-30k. The first gun is not bad, however, and its ammunition is free to refill.+GRAPHICS+Tracking, while simple, is a nice mechanic that I believe is unique for this game series.+The new tracking system includes "need spots" where you can stalk out your prey, for example: One need spot might be a drinking area for a herd of deer, they'll come back here during the time that is stated, and you can simply wait for them to fall into your trap.+A new trophy screen, where it will show you where your bullet hit aswell as a picture detailing the trajectory of it, and how much damage/how lethal it was on a % base, allowing you to learn where to aim next time. I, however, only aim for the neck, because there's nothing quite like paralyzing an animal and then simply walking up to it and finishing it off (thats ♥♥♥♥ed up).+THE GRASS PARTS IF AN ANIMAL (OR YOU) WALK THROUGH IT+The map is HUGE.+The sounds are very nice, and immerses you into the feeling of being in a real forest...except for one of them...-Theres this one sound that sounds exactly like something rubbing up against your jacket. This one sound has made me almost♥♥♥♥♥♥myself atleast 3 times in 2 hours played. I've narrowed it down and I believe it's the sound the rabbits make when they run through the underbrush.-The weather system is out of whack. One minute you've got perfect sunny weather, the next you've got a thunderstorm on your hands which deafens and blindens you (and only you, by the looks of things).-A glitch I've encountered after every 1 shot kill, the HUD of the scope will dissapear, leaving you staring through the plastic edges of a scope as if somebody removed the magnifying glass.-The menu system is crap and needs a total rehaul. The buttons dont respond half the time and esc doesn't actually back you out of the current menu, leaving you struggling to get back in the game just in time to see a bear charging you because you dared exist in a 2km vicinity of her.+-Relatively few animals, however this can be explained by the fact that they're trying to bring us a realistic biome, where every animal on earth doesn't actually live in the same park.I'll try to remember to update this review after I've tried the multiplayer or after the next patch, whichever comes first. However, as it is now, I would recommend this game for anybody who's not gonna get bored of walking through beutiful scenery where you get maybe 1 minute of action for every 10 minute walked.EDIT: Having put a few more hours into this game, it has become clear to me that it is an unfinished mess. While the scenery and all the positives I listed above still apply, the negatives turn this otherwise enjoyable game into a chore itself.Not only do your graphical settings reset if you do ANYTHING other than walking (fire your gun? Your POV is going back to the default 60) but the menu you have to work through in order to change it is, as mentioned above, a pain.I've also noticed a painful unfairness in how terrain affects you. The animal you are stalking can and WILL see or hear you through that mountain inbetween you, and you'll never see it again.While the removal of microtransactions is a good thing, the fact that I have to level up my rifle skills in order to get anything other than the default rifle, sort of makes the same result.They replaced the buying of guns with hours upon hours of grinding.As of now, I cannot recommend this game in its current state. Wait a few months for patches.

content:
Posted: February 17
												EDIT REVIEW:After about 13hrs gameplay and some bugfixes from EW I can now recommend the game. If you can come along with a somehow weird XP system for unlocking and buying stuff and don't give a damn about leaderboards and competitions like in the classic version, then go ahead and buy this game. It is a pure hunting game with great graphics and a promising look into future patches and updates. There are still some bugs (not gamebreaking) but it looks like that they will be fixed soon.---- end of edit ----After this short time of playing (1.8hrs) I can say that there is a big potential in the game but also a lot of bugs which bring you down to typical EW reality.IN THE CURRENT STATE I CAN NOT RECOMMEND TO BUY THIS GAME BECAUSE OF:Small bugs I experienced:- in the menu (no return with ESC, no saving of sound settings for next gameplay)- the inventory (not possible to change between store and storage, freezing menu, not possible to change items from backpack to sorage and vice versa)- the menu itself looks like from a console game and is very complicated to go through- graphic glitches (when you crouch on uneven terrain you can see the 'underworld', sometimes you can see the red color of forgotten textures on objects)- when you change in permanent moving state (key 'G') with empty hands (key 'H') from running to walking the arms still swinging in running state- sometimes when walking with empty hands the mobile phone style Huntermate comes up with no screen (only the frame)This things will bring the fun factor down rapidly and leave you behind with a shaking head.I played the classic version since the very beginning and faced all this problems there. Bugs evolved over the years and piled up till today.The same will happend here I guess. It looks like that this game has not been tested properly before release and now this small bugs will stay there for a looooong time and the customers are fooled again.But that seems to be the politics and normal state with EW.What I not get is that there is a huge community willing to help with beta testing and still EW is not able to do it right. Not even after the mess with the classic version.If you do not have to, than do not buy this game now. Wait for a couple of months and some bug fixing which will hopefully occur....

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 16
												Edit after Patch 1.1:First of all i now did change my rating from thumbs down to up and here is why.The developer has addressed many issues i had with the game, mainly the interface and menu problems which for me are all gone but one thing, i could not change my resolution anymore because the apply button next to it did not work, but i am sure this will be adressed quickly since it did work before 1.1When it comes to gameplay issues and bugs caused by the environment i know these will take time to adjust since its such a big game and i for myself do not expect that this is done overnight.I will however say i do not like the ui they chose in the store and inventory, its so different form everything else you are used to as a gamer and it is not intuitive, but once you get the hang of it it works.Overall i recommend this game for everyone who meets the necessary minimum specs,especially considering the price, which is only half of what has become the standard price for games today.I hope the developer stays on track with the patches and if anything major game breaking happens in the future i will edit this review again.Inital review:This game is clearly in an unfinished state, mainly problems with menus and keybindings, graphic glitches and so forth.I was hyped for the game for a long time since i have 400H played in the hunter classic.In this game like in so many other as a day one buyer you feel like a beta tester thats a real shame, at least mark it as early access then.I will change my review when the game is in a playable state since you could get a lot for your money here when it finaly works.EDIT: Since this review somehow made it to the top of the reviews i kinda feel obliged to add a little bit more so people see more then just a day 1 rant for their first review.Like stated above the games menus and configuration is what causes the most problems for me those are things that are easily fixable however and might depend on what hardware specs you use so here a mine for a little more insight. My pc is build by myself and is all new from January 2017CPU: i5 7600K @ 5.0GHZ MOBO: Asrock z170 Extreme 4 GPU: Powercolor Red Devil RX480 8GB RAM: 16GB Corsair Vengeance @ 3000 CL15With that pc i do not have any problems running the game in 1440p fps wise but i still encounter random crashes that can not be attributed to anything in particular, sometimes when i press esc sometimes when i just press E to respond to a call.The mouse sensitivy setting seem to take no effect i got a logitech G402 but other people have also brought up this issue in the steam forums.Keybinding is a nightmare its unresponsive and never unbind you mouse buttons or you cant restore them unless you scroll down to the end and do a reset to default, if you want to bind mouse 4 or 5 (side buttons) the game crashes instantly.The animal AI is not very clever, the pathfinding is just not done well enough, they run into things all the time and get stuck, also once they run away from you they will only remember your last postion, so you can make them flee into your arms when you spook them a second time, kinda funny but anoying.Also HoorCairs a well respected community member did say on his Youtube lets play that the best way to shoot deer is to run trough the woods an go after them when they flee since its the easiest way to track them, thats true and shouldnt be like that.The first rifle with the default ammo does nearly no damage at all, and searching and finding a wounded animal is hard since the ui is so overloaded with informations from other animals.I do see why they did that since you need to have a reason to justify the other rifles but they overdid it on that one in my opinion.I could list more game mechanic issues, but just refere to the steam forum of the game and you will see them, so i'm not going to list them all here since this was never meant to be such a long review in the first place, i only want people to be aware that at this time the game feels more like a beta then a finished game.And as always you are welcome to disagree, especially on the gameplay elements, but please also respect other peoples opinions.

content:
Posted: March 6
												I personally hunt in real life, and I've always enjoyed hunting games. Yes, it's not completely realistic, but it's kind of close. The deer can glitch out and run in place making for an easy kill, the deer don't recognize you as quickly as they do in real life, and some deer can run for miles in the game with a bullet in their lung. But, I'll start talking about some of the good things that this game has to offer. there's a nice selection of weapons in the game (In my opinion), though you need a certain "Rifle Score" or "Handgun score" or "Shotgun score" to be able to buy them (the scores need to be in their respective categories. So for unlocks some rifles a higher rifle score is needed etc...). That needed score can need to be quite high to be able to buy some of the guns, and it'll take a while, but I have fun in the game. There is also a lot of animals to shhot. I personally am still using the gun the game gives you at the start because I like it, though you might need some more powerful guns to take down some bears, and moose quicker (the starting gun is still pretty good though). Yes, some people might say "He only has 9 hours into the game (Currently), why should I listen to his opinion?". My answer: you don't need to listen to my opinion if you don't want to listen to it. That's your decision if you want to listen to me. I could write for a long time on this game, and I haven't listed all of the things that this game has to offer, but I'll update this when I get further into the game. I would like to see this game have some vehicles added to it because running 5 miles is not very fun, and it takes a VERY long time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 6
												So what do I think of this game?------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------TL;dr version:Overall I give it an 8 / 10.Should you get it? If you are worried about bugs/glitches then I would wait until they get some patches going to make the game more stable. Other than that, I say get it and enjoy it. It's amazing!The new-release crashes/issues are dragging down the experience a bit (though this is of course temporary until they get it fixed) and the somewhat limited amount of animals and gear (compared to my experience in Classic) means it has some extra efforts needed to be put in to give a higher rating.On the positive side it has amazing graphics, fun gameplay (easy to get into and find animals to shoot) and a progression and mission system which allows you to forget the time and stay in the game for hours. The developers have shown in the Classic that they always keep adding content to the game. I am confident they will do the same for this game.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------First off lets take a moment and realize that the game is fresh out the door at time of writing (currently patch 1.21), and some of things I will be mentioning in this review may be resolved in the near future.The positives Amazing graphics. Game looks absolutely stunning. Progression system (listing this as a positive) which gives you a sense of accomplishment when you can afford a new gun or afford new lures and so on. Skill / perk system that allows you to fine tune your hunter for your preferred hunting style. Easier to hunt and kill animals (compared to Classic) which makes it more available for average / casual gamer. Mission (quest) system which encourages you to explore the mapThe negatives (most of these are related to current issues and content, both which I am convinced will be improved upon in future). Crashes/freezing is a big one. Personally I can play singleplayer without issues, but multiplayer freezes me up after about 10-15 minutes in. Expecting this to be resolved in very near future. Animal AI can sometimes be a bit silly. I can spot 2 Roe Deer, shoot one, immediately use the Lure Caller and the 2nd Roe Deer will wander right back in mere minutes allowing me to shoot it. Animals should be a bit less... well... stupid? Animal pathing causes them to get stuck. Not uncommon to see an animal that is 'glitching out' as it has become stuck between two rocks, or two trees or something similar. Some UI issues, e.g. no Exit to Main Menu (only exit to desktop). Some settings do not stay saved, e.g. changing Aim (through scope) to Toggle rather than holding down RMB will reset back to holding down button after awhile (seems to happen after harvesting a kill)For the Classic hunters!So how what is missing compared to the Classic? First off there is not too many animals in the game (yet). About 6-7 animals on each map. This is about same as for a single map in Classic though, but it means the total variation of animals is a bit smaller. Fairly modest selection of weapons and lures where in Classic you a huge selection of weapons, callers, lures and equipment. No bird hunting in the game (although you often find birds sitting on ground who then take flight when you get close) No small game hunting (besides Red Fox / Coyote). You can find rabbits and squirrels running around (and even shoot them) but you can't harvest them for points. No placeable equipment such ground blinds, tree stands, feeders and such. No doggies.What I am hoping for in the future:More animals (small game and birds especially)More weaponsMore equipmentDoggies!Placeable equipmentAll of these things I am sure will be coming in the future though. The Classic game has had many years of regularly adding content to the game to expand it to the huge hunting game it is now with such a rich and varied amount of content.I have complete faith in this game as well and trust the developers to be adding more and more content to this game over the coming months and years ahead to make this new hunting game just as rich and amazing as it's older brother.Stay with it and great things will happen!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 16
												Edit after Patch 1.1:First of all i now did change my rating from thumbs down to up and here is why.The developer has addressed many issues i had with the game, mainly the interface and menu problems which for me are all gone but one thing, i could not change my resolution anymore because the apply button next to it did not work, but i am sure this will be adressed quickly since it did work before 1.1When it comes to gameplay issues and bugs caused by the environment i know these will take time to adjust since its such a big game and i for myself do not expect that this is done overnight.I will however say i do not like the ui they chose in the store and inventory, its so different form everything else you are used to as a gamer and it is not intuitive, but once you get the hang of it it works.Overall i recommend this game for everyone who meets the necessary minimum specs,especially considering the price, which is only half of what has become the standard price for games today.I hope the developer stays on track with the patches and if anything major game breaking happens in the future i will edit this review again.Inital review:This game is clearly in an unfinished state, mainly problems with menus and keybindings, graphic glitches and so forth.I was hyped for the game for a long time since i have 400H played in the hunter classic.In this game like in so many other as a day one buyer you feel like a beta tester thats a real shame, at least mark it as early access then.I will change my review when the game is in a playable state since you could get a lot for your money here when it finaly works.EDIT: Since this review somehow made it to the top of the reviews i kinda feel obliged to add a little bit more so people see more then just a day 1 rant for their first review.Like stated above the games menus and configuration is what causes the most problems for me those are things that are easily fixable however and might depend on what hardware specs you use so here a mine for a little more insight. My pc is build by myself and is all new from January 2017CPU: i5 7600K @ 5.0GHZ MOBO: Asrock z170 Extreme 4 GPU: Powercolor Red Devil RX480 8GB RAM: 16GB Corsair Vengeance @ 3000 CL15With that pc i do not have any problems running the game in 1440p fps wise but i still encounter random crashes that can not be attributed to anything in particular, sometimes when i press esc sometimes when i just press E to respond to a call.The mouse sensitivy setting seem to take no effect i got a logitech G402 but other people have also brought up this issue in the steam forums.Keybinding is a nightmare its unresponsive and never unbind you mouse buttons or you cant restore them unless you scroll down to the end and do a reset to default, if you want to bind mouse 4 or 5 (side buttons) the game crashes instantly.The animal AI is not very clever, the pathfinding is just not done well enough, they run into things all the time and get stuck, also once they run away from you they will only remember your last postion, so you can make them flee into your arms when you spook them a second time, kinda funny but anoying.Also HoorCairs a well respected community member did say on his Youtube lets play that the best way to shoot deer is to run trough the woods an go after them when they flee since its the easiest way to track them, thats true and shouldnt be like that.The first rifle with the default ammo does nearly no damage at all, and searching and finding a wounded animal is hard since the ui is so overloaded with informations from other animals.I do see why they did that since you need to have a reason to justify the other rifles but they overdid it on that one in my opinion.I could list more game mechanic issues, but just refere to the steam forum of the game and you will see them, so i'm not going to list them all here since this was never meant to be such a long review in the first place, i only want people to be aware that at this time the game feels more like a beta then a finished game.And as always you are welcome to disagree, especially on the gameplay elements, but please also respect other peoples opinions.

Posted: April 16
												This game has a lot of potential, but it has a few bugs and is in mostly recommended for Console. I really didn't have any problems with the game at all but a few crashes here and there which made me restart from the very beginning. There aren't very many bugs like people say in the comments except for simple fix ones like, ALT-TAB out, or Graphics Card Crash. I'm just going to skip to the Pros, Cons, and Suggestions I have for the furture.Pros:-Beautiful Graphics -Smooth Gun Mechanics -Realistic Hunting Aspects-Runs good on High-end and low-end comuters-A Very Slow Paced Game-Fun to Play but You need to take the Time and Play It-Easy Controls-Multiplayer is fun if you have friend to play with-A Lot More You Need to Find Out Yourself!Cons:-Unexpected Crashes here and there-Not A Wide Selection on Weapons-Bullets do not penatrate through bones hitting Vital Organs (That I know of from my expirence)-Running is very slow-No Usual Updates for PC version (This Game is Mostly for Consoles)Suggestions:-Update the game more for PC!-Fix the Bugs-Add more DLC-Vechicles (It's a pain to have to slowly run everywhere)-More Varity of Weapons and Items OverallIn conculsion, this is a fun game overall but lacks a variety of espacts to add to the game. Just remember this is a game that was just released and they are still working on it, I understand! I would recommend this game if you like slow-paced and immersive games like I do!Cheers! -Xpheire

content:
Posted: March 3
												New patch just came out today and it shows the developers are listening to feedback and acting upon it fairly quickly.  This is huge and is why I am here righting a review.  This still feels a bit like a beta launch and there are more kinks to work out but overall the game is progressing nicely.  Its a lot like the orginal but much improved visually.  Some of the changes in feel were hard to adjust to but now are growing on me.  Overall I still recomend the game but know its not quite fully polished.  Biggest problem, and this is going to kill the game if not fixed IMO, we need multiplayer competitions that you can play accross the entire game, and we need this sooner rather than later.  These competitions are the only reason why myself and so many others continued to play the orginal Hunter and are vastly important to the longevity of the new game.  The current single server comps are a good adition but are still a bit unrealiable and are no where near a replacement for a real comp system like the original.

												I've had a great time playing theHunter call of the wild. A huge improvement over thehunter classic. Way more immersive,beautiful, enjoyable. I recommend this to anyone who was in love with the original hunter game, and people coming new to this series. They do have some bugs here and there, but nothing was game breaking for me, i binged hours on end in weekends, the experience was very enjoyable.
